76// Verbatim copy from CLI/Macros.hpp:
77
78
79// The following version macro is very similar to the one in PyBind11
80#if !(defined(_MSC_VER) && __cplusplus == 199711L) && !defined(__INTEL_COMPILER)
81#if __cplusplus >= 201402L
82#define CLI11_CPP14
83#if __cplusplus >= 201703L
84#define CLI11_CPP17
85#if __cplusplus > 201703L
86#define CLI11_CPP20
87#endif
88#endif
89#endif
90#elif defined(_MSC_VER) && __cplusplus == 199711L
91// MSVC sets _MSVC_LANG rather than __cplusplus (supposedly until the standard is fully implemented)
92// Unless you use the /Zc:__cplusplus flag on Visual Studio 2017 15.7 Preview 3 or newer
93#if _MSVC_LANG >= 201402L
94#define CLI11_CPP14
95#if _MSVC_LANG > 201402L && _MSC_VER >= 1910
96#define CLI11_CPP17
97#if __MSVC_LANG > 201703L && _MSC_VER >= 1910
98#define CLI11_CPP20
99#endif
100#endif
101#endif
102#endif
103
104#if defined(CLI11_CPP14)
105#define CLI11_DEPRECATED(reason) [[deprecated(reason)]]
106#elif defined(_MSC_VER)
107#define CLI11_DEPRECATED(reason) __declspec(deprecated(reason))
108#else
109#define CLI11_DEPRECATED(reason) __attribute__((deprecated(reason)))
110#endif

115// Verbatim copy from CLI/Validators.hpp:
116
117
118// C standard library
119// Only needed for existence checking
120#if defined CLI11_CPP17 && defined __has_include && !defined CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM
121#if __has_include(<filesystem>)
122// Filesystem cannot be used if targeting macOS < 10.15
123#if defined __MAC_OS_X_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED && __MAC_OS_X_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED < 101500
124#define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 0
125#else
126#include <filesystem>
127#if defined __cpp_lib_filesystem && __cpp_lib_filesystem >= 201703
128#define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 1
129#else
130#define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 0
131#endif
132#endif
133#endif
134#endif
135
136#if defined CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM && CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM > 0
137#include <filesystem> // NOLINT(build/include)
138#else
139#include <sys/stat.h>
140#include <sys/types.h>
141#endif

153// From CLI/StringTools.hpp:

155namespace CLI {
156
159namespace enums {
160
162template <typename T, typename = typename std::enable_if<std::is_enum<T>::value>::type>
163std::ostream &operator<<(std::ostream &in, const T &item) {
164 // make sure this is out of the detail namespace otherwise it won't be found when needed
165 return in << static_cast<typename std::underlying_type<T>::type>(item);
166}
167
168} // namespace enums
169
171using enums::operator<<;
172
173namespace detail {
176constexpr int expected_max_vector_size{1 << 29};
177// Based on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/236129/split-a-string-in-c
179inline std::vector<std::string> split(const std::string &s, char delim) {
180 std::vector<std::string> elems;
181 // Check to see if empty string, give consistent result
182 if(s.empty())
183 elems.emplace_back();
184 else {
185 std::stringstream ss;
186 ss.str(s);
187 std::string item;
188 while(std::getline(ss, item, delim)) {
189 elems.push_back(item);
190 }
191 }
192 return elems;
193}
194
196template <typename T> std::string join(const T &v, std::string delim = ",") {
197 std::ostringstream s;
198 auto beg = std::begin(v);
199 auto end = std::end(v);
200 if(beg != end)
201 s << *beg++;
202 while(beg != end) {
203 s << delim << *beg++;
204 }
205 return s.str();
206}
207
209template <typename T,
210 typename Callable,
211 typename = typename std::enable_if<!std::is_constructible<std::string, Callable>::value>::type>
212std::string join(const T &v, Callable func, std::string delim = ",") {
213 std::ostringstream s;
214 auto beg = std::begin(v);
215 auto end = std::end(v);
216 if(beg != end)
217 s << func(*beg++);
218 while(beg != end) {
219 s << delim << func(*beg++);
220 }
221 return s.str();
222}
223
225template <typename T> std::string rjoin(const T &v, std::string delim = ",") {
226 std::ostringstream s;
227 for(std::size_t start = 0; start < v.size(); start++) {
228 if(start > 0)
229 s << delim;
230 s << v[v.size() - start - 1];
231 }
232 return s.str();
233}
234
235// Based roughly on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/25829143/c-trim-whitespace-from-a-string
236
238inline std::string &ltrim(std::string &str) {
239 auto it = std::find_if(str.begin(), str.end(), [](char ch) { return !std::isspace<char>(ch, std::locale()); });
240 str.erase(str.begin(), it);
241 return str;
242}
243
245inline std::string &ltrim(std::string &str, const std::string &filter) {
246 auto it = std::find_if(str.begin(), str.end(), [&filter](char ch) { return filter.find(ch) == std::string::npos; });
247 str.erase(str.begin(), it);
248 return str;
249}
250
252inline std::string &rtrim(std::string &str) {
253 auto it = std::find_if(str.rbegin(), str.rend(), [](char ch) { return !std::isspace<char>(ch, std::locale()); });
254 str.erase(it.base(), str.end());
255 return str;
256}
257
259inline std::string &rtrim(std::string &str, const std::string &filter) {
260 auto it =
261 std::find_if(str.rbegin(), str.rend(), [&filter](char ch) { return filter.find(ch) == std::string::npos; });
262 str.erase(it.base(), str.end());
263 return str;
264}
265
267inline std::string &trim(std::string &str) { return ltrim(rtrim(str)); }
268
270inline std::string &trim(std::string &str, const std::string filter) { return ltrim(rtrim(str, filter), filter); }
271
273inline std::string trim_copy(const std::string &str) {
274 std::string s = str;
275 return trim(s);
276}
277
279inline std::string &remove_quotes(std::string &str) {
280 if(str.length() > 1 && (str.front() == '"' || str.front() == '\'')) {
281 if(str.front() == str.back()) {
282 str.pop_back();
283 str.erase(str.begin(), str.begin() + 1);
284 }
285 }
286 return str;
287}
288
290inline std::string trim_copy(const std::string &str, const std::string &filter) {
291 std::string s = str;
292 return trim(s, filter);
293}
295inline std::ostream &format_help(std::ostream &out, std::string name, std::string description, std::size_t wid) {
296 name = " " + name;
297 out << std::setw(static_cast<int>(wid)) << std::left << name;
298 if(!description.empty()) {
299 if(name.length() >= wid)
300 out << "\n" << std::setw(static_cast<int>(wid)) << "";
301 for(const char c : description) {
302 out.put(c);
303 if(c == '\n') {
304 out << std::setw(static_cast<int>(wid)) << "";
305 }
306 }
307 }
308 out << "\n";
309 return out;
310}
311
313template <typename T> bool valid_first_char(T c) {
314 return std::isalnum(c, std::locale()) || c == '_' || c == '?' || c == '@';
315}
316
318template <typename T> bool valid_later_char(T c) { return valid_first_char(c) || c == '.' || c == '-'; }
319
321inline bool valid_name_string(const std::string &str) {
322 if(str.empty() || !valid_first_char(str[0]))
323 return false;
324 for(auto c : str.substr(1))
325 if(!valid_later_char(c))
326 return false;
327 return true;
328}
329
331inline bool isalpha(const std::string &str) {
332 return std::all_of(str.begin(), str.end(), [](char c) { return std::isalpha(c, std::locale()); });
333}
334
336inline std::string to_lower(std::string str) {
337 std::transform(std::begin(str), std::end(str), std::begin(str), [](const std::string::value_type &x) {
338 return std::tolower(x, std::locale());
339 });
340 return str;
341}
342
344inline std::string remove_underscore(std::string str) {
345 str.erase(std::remove(std::begin(str), std::end(str), '_'), std::end(str));
346 return str;
347}
348
350inline std::string find_and_replace(std::string str, std::string from, std::string to) {
351
352 std::size_t start_pos = 0;
353
354 while((start_pos = str.find(from, start_pos)) != std::string::npos) {
355 str.replace(start_pos, from.length(), to);
356 start_pos += to.length();
357 }
358
359 return str;
360}
361
363inline bool has_default_flag_values(const std::string &flags) {
364 return (flags.find_first_of("{!") != std::string::npos);
365}
366
367inline void remove_default_flag_values(std::string &flags) {
368 auto loc = flags.find_first_of('{');
369 while(loc != std::string::npos) {
370 auto finish = flags.find_first_of("},", loc + 1);
371 if((finish != std::string::npos) && (flags[finish] == '}')) {
372 flags.erase(flags.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(loc),
373 flags.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(finish) + 1);
374 }
375 loc = flags.find_first_of('{', loc + 1);
376 }
377 flags.erase(std::remove(flags.begin(), flags.end(), '!'), flags.end());
378}
379
381inline std::ptrdiff_t find_member(std::string name,
382 const std::vector<std::string> names,
383 bool ignore_case = false,
384 bool ignore_underscore = false) {
385 auto it = std::end(names);
386 if(ignore_case) {
387 if(ignore_underscore) {
388 name = detail::to_lower(detail::remove_underscore(name));
389 it = std::find_if(std::begin(names), std::end(names), [&name](std::string local_name) {
390 return detail::to_lower(detail::remove_underscore(local_name)) == name;
391 });
392 } else {
393 name = detail::to_lower(name);
394 it = std::find_if(std::begin(names), std::end(names), [&name](std::string local_name) {
395 return detail::to_lower(local_name) == name;
396 });
397 }
398
399 } else if(ignore_underscore) {
400 name = detail::remove_underscore(name);
401 it = std::find_if(std::begin(names), std::end(names), [&name](std::string local_name) {
402 return detail::remove_underscore(local_name) == name;
403 });
404 } else
405 it = std::find(std::begin(names), std::end(names), name);
406
407 return (it != std::end(names)) ? (it - std::begin(names)) : (-1);
408}
409
412template <typename Callable> inline std::string find_and_modify(std::string str, std::string trigger, Callable modify) {
413 std::size_t start_pos = 0;
414 while((start_pos = str.find(trigger, start_pos)) != std::string::npos) {
415 start_pos = modify(str, start_pos);
416 }
417 return str;
418}
419
422inline std::vector<std::string> split_up(std::string str, char delimiter = '\0') {
423
424 const std::string delims("\'\"`");
425 auto find_ws = [delimiter](char ch) {
426 return (delimiter == '\0') ? (std::isspace<char>(ch, std::locale()) != 0) : (ch == delimiter);
427 };
428 trim(str);
429
430 std::vector<std::string> output;
431 bool embeddedQuote = false;
432 char keyChar = ' ';
433 while(!str.empty()) {
434 if(delims.find_first_of(str[0]) != std::string::npos) {
435 keyChar = str[0];
436 auto end = str.find_first_of(keyChar, 1);
437 while((end != std::string::npos) && (str[end - 1] == '\\')) { // deal with escaped quotes
438 end = str.find_first_of(keyChar, end + 1);
439 embeddedQuote = true;
440 }
441 if(end != std::string::npos) {
442 output.push_back(str.substr(1, end - 1));
443 str = str.substr(end + 1);
444 } else {
445 output.push_back(str.substr(1));
446 str = "";
447 }
448 } else {
449 auto it = std::find_if(std::begin(str), std::end(str), find_ws);
450 if(it != std::end(str)) {
451 std::string value = std::string(str.begin(), it);
452 output.push_back(value);
453 str = std::string(it + 1, str.end());
454 } else {
455 output.push_back(str);
456 str = "";
457 }
458 }
459 // transform any embedded quotes into the regular character
460 if(embeddedQuote) {
461 output.back() = find_and_replace(output.back(), std::string("\\") + keyChar, std::string(1, keyChar));
462 embeddedQuote = false;
463 }
464 trim(str);
465 }
466 return output;
467}
468
473inline std::string fix_newlines(const std::string &leader, std::string input) {
474 std::string::size_type n = 0;
475 while(n != std::string::npos && n < input.size()) {
476 n = input.find('\n', n);
477 if(n != std::string::npos) {
478 input = input.substr(0, n + 1) + leader + input.substr(n + 1);
479 n += leader.size();
480 }
481 }
482 return input;
483}
484
489inline std::size_t escape_detect(std::string &str, std::size_t offset) {
490 auto next = str[offset + 1];
491 if((next == '\"') || (next == '\'') || (next == '`')) {
492 auto astart = str.find_last_of("-/ \"\'`", offset - 1);
493 if(astart != std::string::npos) {
494 if(str[astart] == ((str[offset] == '=') ? '-' : '/'))
495 str[offset] = ' '; // interpret this as a space so the split_up works properly
496 }
497 }
498 return offset + 1;
499}
500
502inline std::string &add_quotes_if_needed(std::string &str) {
503 if((str.front() != '"' && str.front() != '\'') || str.front() != str.back()) {
504 char quote = str.find('"') < str.find('\'') ? '\'' : '"';
505 if(str.find(' ') != std::string::npos) {
506 str.insert(0, 1, quote);
507 str.append(1, quote);
508 }
509 }
510 return str;
511}
512
513} // namespace detail
514
515} // namespace CLI
516
517// From CLI/Error.hpp:
518
519namespace CLI {
520
521// Use one of these on all error classes.
522// These are temporary and are undef'd at the end of this file.
523#define CLI11_ERROR_DEF(parent, name) \
524 protected: \
525 name(std::string ename, std::string msg, int exit_code) : parent(std::move(ename), std::move(msg), exit_code) {} \
526 name(std::string ename, std::string msg, ExitCodes exit_code) \
527 : parent(std::move(ename), std::move(msg), exit_code) {} \
528 \
529 public: \
530 name(std::string msg, ExitCodes exit_code) : parent(#name, std::move(msg), exit_code) {} \
531 name(std::string msg, int exit_code) : parent(#name, std::move(msg), exit_code) {}
532
533// This is added after the one above if a class is used directly and builds its own message
534#define CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(name) \
535 explicit name(std::string msg) : name(#name, msg, ExitCodes::name) {}
536
539enum class ExitCodes {
540 Success = 0,
541 IncorrectConstruction = 100,
542 BadNameString,
543 OptionAlreadyAdded,
544 FileError,
545 ConversionError,
546 ValidationError,
547 RequiredError,
548 RequiresError,
549 ExcludesError,
550 ExtrasError,
551 ConfigError,
552 InvalidError,
553 HorribleError,
554 OptionNotFound,
555 ArgumentMismatch,
556 BaseClass = 127
557};
558
559// Error definitions
560
566
568class Error : public std::runtime_error {
569 int actual_exit_code;
570 std::string error_name{"Error"};
571
572 public:
573 int get_exit_code() const { return actual_exit_code; }
574
575 std::string get_name() const { return error_name; }
576
577 Error(std::string name, std::string msg, int exit_code = static_cast<int>(ExitCodes::BaseClass))
578 : runtime_error(msg), actual_exit_code(exit_code), error_name(std::move(name)) {}
579
580 Error(std::string name, std::string msg, ExitCodes exit_code) : Error(name, msg, static_cast<int>(exit_code)) {}
581};
582
583// Note: Using Error::Error constructors does not work on GCC 4.7
584
586class ConstructionError : public Error {
587 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Error, ConstructionError)
588};
589
591class IncorrectConstruction : public ConstructionError {
592 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ConstructionError, IncorrectConstruction)
593 CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(IncorrectConstruction)
594 static IncorrectConstruction PositionalFlag(std::string name) {
595 return IncorrectConstruction(name + ": Flags cannot be positional");
596 }
597 static IncorrectConstruction Set0Opt(std::string name) {
598 return IncorrectConstruction(name + ": Cannot set 0 expected, use a flag instead");
599 }
600 static IncorrectConstruction SetFlag(std::string name) {
601 return IncorrectConstruction(name + ": Cannot set an expected number for flags");
602 }
603 static IncorrectConstruction ChangeNotVector(std::string name) {
604 return IncorrectConstruction(name + ": You can only change the expected arguments for vectors");
605 }
606 static IncorrectConstruction AfterMultiOpt(std::string name) {
607 return IncorrectConstruction(
608 name + ": You can't change expected arguments after you've changed the multi option policy!");
609 }
610 static IncorrectConstruction MissingOption(std::string name) {
611 return IncorrectConstruction("Option " + name + " is not defined");
612 }
613 static IncorrectConstruction MultiOptionPolicy(std::string name) {
614 return IncorrectConstruction(name + ": multi_option_policy only works for flags and exact value options");
615 }
616};
617
619class BadNameString : public ConstructionError {
620 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ConstructionError, BadNameString)
621 CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(BadNameString)
622 static BadNameString OneCharName(std::string name) { return BadNameString("Invalid one char name: " + name); }
623 static BadNameString BadLongName(std::string name) { return BadNameString("Bad long name: " + name); }
624 static BadNameString DashesOnly(std::string name) {
625 return BadNameString("Must have a name, not just dashes: " + name);
626 }
627 static BadNameString MultiPositionalNames(std::string name) {
628 return BadNameString("Only one positional name allowed, remove: " + name);
629 }
630};
631
633class OptionAlreadyAdded : public ConstructionError {
634 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ConstructionError, OptionAlreadyAdded)
635 explicit OptionAlreadyAdded(std::string name)
636 : OptionAlreadyAdded(name + " is already added", ExitCodes::OptionAlreadyAdded) {}
637 static OptionAlreadyAdded Requires(std::string name, std::string other) {
638 return OptionAlreadyAdded(name + " requires " + other, ExitCodes::OptionAlreadyAdded);
639 }
640 static OptionAlreadyAdded Excludes(std::string name, std::string other) {
641 return OptionAlreadyAdded(name + " excludes " + other, ExitCodes::OptionAlreadyAdded);
642 }
643};
644
645// Parsing errors
646
648class ParseError : public Error {
649 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Error, ParseError)
650};
651
652// Not really "errors"
653
655class Success : public ParseError {
656 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, Success)
657 Success() : Success("Successfully completed, should be caught and quit", ExitCodes::Success) {}
658};
659
661class CallForHelp : public ParseError {
662 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, CallForHelp)
663 CallForHelp() : CallForHelp("This should be caught in your main function, see examples", ExitCodes::Success) {}
664};
665
667class CallForAllHelp : public ParseError {
668 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, CallForAllHelp)
669 CallForAllHelp()
670 : CallForAllHelp("This should be caught in your main function, see examples", ExitCodes::Success) {}
671};
672
674class RuntimeError : public ParseError {
675 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, RuntimeError)
676 explicit RuntimeError(int exit_code = 1) : RuntimeError("Runtime error", exit_code) {}
677};
678
680class FileError : public ParseError {
681 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, FileError)
682 CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(FileError)
683 static FileError Missing(std::string name) { return FileError(name + " was not readable (missing?)"); }
684};
685
687class ConversionError : public ParseError {
688 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ConversionError)
689 CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(ConversionError)
690 ConversionError(std::string member, std::string name)
691 : ConversionError("The value " + member + " is not an allowed value for " + name) {}
692 ConversionError(std::string name, std::vector<std::string> results)
693 : ConversionError("Could not convert: " + name + " = " + detail::join(results)) {}
694 static ConversionError TooManyInputsFlag(std::string name) {
695 return ConversionError(name + ": too many inputs for a flag");
696 }
697 static ConversionError TrueFalse(std::string name) {
698 return ConversionError(name + ": Should be true/false or a number");
699 }
700};
701
703class ValidationError : public ParseError {
704 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ValidationError)
705 CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(ValidationError)
706 explicit ValidationError(std::string name, std::string msg) : ValidationError(name + ": " + msg) {}
707};
708
710class RequiredError : public ParseError {
711 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, RequiredError)
712 explicit RequiredError(std::string name) : RequiredError(name + " is required", ExitCodes::RequiredError) {}
713 static RequiredError Subcommand(std::size_t min_subcom) {
714 if(min_subcom == 1) {
715 return RequiredError("A subcommand");
716 }
717 return RequiredError("Requires at least " + std::to_string(min_subcom) + " subcommands",
718 ExitCodes::RequiredError);
719 }
720 static RequiredError
721 Option(std::size_t min_option, std::size_t max_option, std::size_t used, const std::string &option_list) {
722 if((min_option == 1) && (max_option == 1) && (used == 0))
723 return RequiredError("Exactly 1 option from [" + option_list + "]");
724 if((min_option == 1) && (max_option == 1) && (used > 1)) {
725 return RequiredError("Exactly 1 option from [" + option_list + "] is required and " + std::to_string(used) +
726 " were given",
727 ExitCodes::RequiredError);
728 }
729 if((min_option == 1) && (used == 0))
730 return RequiredError("At least 1 option from [" + option_list + "]");
731 if(used < min_option) {
732 return RequiredError("Requires at least " + std::to_string(min_option) + " options used and only " +
733 std::to_string(used) + "were given from [" + option_list + "]",
734 ExitCodes::RequiredError);
735 }
736 if(max_option == 1)
737 return RequiredError("Requires at most 1 options be given from [" + option_list + "]",
738 ExitCodes::RequiredError);
739
740 return RequiredError("Requires at most " + std::to_string(max_option) + " options be used and " +
741 std::to_string(used) + "were given from [" + option_list + "]",
742 ExitCodes::RequiredError);
743 }
744};
745
747class ArgumentMismatch : public ParseError {
748 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ArgumentMismatch)
749 CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(ArgumentMismatch)
750 ArgumentMismatch(std::string name, int expected, std::size_t recieved)
751 : ArgumentMismatch(expected > 0 ? ("Expected exactly " + std::to_string(expected) + " arguments to " + name +
752 ", got " + std::to_string(recieved))
753 : ("Expected at least " + std::to_string(-expected) + " arguments to " + name +
754 ", got " + std::to_string(recieved)),
755 ExitCodes::ArgumentMismatch) {}
756
757 static ArgumentMismatch AtLeast(std::string name, int num, std::size_t received) {
758 return ArgumentMismatch(name + ": At least " + std::to_string(num) + " required but received " +
759 std::to_string(received));
760 }
761 static ArgumentMismatch AtMost(std::string name, int num, std::size_t received) {
762 return ArgumentMismatch(name + ": At Most " + std::to_string(num) + " required but received " +
763 std::to_string(received));
764 }
765 static ArgumentMismatch TypedAtLeast(std::string name, int num, std::string type) {
766 return ArgumentMismatch(name + ": " + std::to_string(num) + " required " + type + " missing");
767 }
768 static ArgumentMismatch FlagOverride(std::string name) {
769 return ArgumentMismatch(name + " was given a disallowed flag override");
770 }
771};
772
774class RequiresError : public ParseError {
775 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, RequiresError)
776 RequiresError(std::string curname, std::string subname)
777 : RequiresError(curname + " requires " + subname, ExitCodes::RequiresError) {}
778};
779
781class ExcludesError : public ParseError {
782 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ExcludesError)
783 ExcludesError(std::string curname, std::string subname)
784 : ExcludesError(curname + " excludes " + subname, ExitCodes::ExcludesError) {}
785};
786
788class ExtrasError : public ParseError {
789 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ExtrasError)
790 explicit ExtrasError(std::vector<std::string> args)
791 : ExtrasError((args.size() > 1 ? "The following arguments were not expected: "
792 : "The following argument was not expected: ") +
793 detail::rjoin(args, " "),
794 ExitCodes::ExtrasError) {}
795 ExtrasError(const std::string &name, std::vector<std::string> args)
796 : ExtrasError(name,
797 (args.size() > 1 ? "The following arguments were not expected: "
798 : "The following argument was not expected: ") +
799 detail::rjoin(args, " "),
800 ExitCodes::ExtrasError) {}
801};
802
804class ConfigError : public ParseError {
805 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ConfigError)
806 CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(ConfigError)
807 static ConfigError Extras(std::string item) { return ConfigError("INI was not able to parse " + item); }
808 static ConfigError NotConfigurable(std::string item) {
809 return ConfigError(item + ": This option is not allowed in a configuration file");
810 }
811};
812
814class InvalidError : public ParseError {
815 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, InvalidError)
816 explicit InvalidError(std::string name)
817 : InvalidError(name + ": Too many positional arguments with unlimited expected args", ExitCodes::InvalidError) {
818 }
819};
820
823class HorribleError : public ParseError {
824 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, HorribleError)
825 CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(HorribleError)
826};
827
828// After parsing
829
831class OptionNotFound : public Error {
832 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Error, OptionNotFound)
833 explicit OptionNotFound(std::string name) : OptionNotFound(name + " not found", ExitCodes::OptionNotFound) {}
834};
835
836#undef CLI11_ERROR_DEF
837#undef CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE
838
840
841} // namespace CLI
842
843// From CLI/TypeTools.hpp:
844
845namespace CLI {
846
847// Type tools
848
849// Utilities for type enabling
850namespace detail {
851// Based generally on https://rmf.io/cxx11/almost-static-if
853enum class enabler {};
854
856constexpr enabler dummy = {};
857} // namespace detail
858
864template <bool B, class T = void> using enable_if_t = typename std::enable_if<B, T>::type;
865
867template <typename... Ts> struct make_void { using type = void; };
868
870template <typename... Ts> using void_t = typename make_void<Ts...>::type;
871
873template <bool B, class T, class F> using conditional_t = typename std::conditional<B, T, F>::type;
874
876template <typename T> struct is_vector : std::false_type {};
877
879template <class T, class A> struct is_vector<std::vector<T, A>> : std::true_type {};
880
882template <class T, class A> struct is_vector<const std::vector<T, A>> : std::true_type {};
883
885template <typename T> struct is_bool : std::false_type {};
886
888template <> struct is_bool<bool> : std::true_type {};
889
891template <typename T> struct is_shared_ptr : std::false_type {};
892
894template <typename T> struct is_shared_ptr<std::shared_ptr<T>> : std::true_type {};
895
897template <typename T> struct is_shared_ptr<const std::shared_ptr<T>> : std::true_type {};
898
900template <typename T> struct is_copyable_ptr {
901 static bool const value = is_shared_ptr<T>::value || std::is_pointer<T>::value;
902};
903
905template <typename T> struct IsMemberType { using type = T; };
906
908template <> struct IsMemberType<const char *> { using type = std::string; };
909
910namespace detail {
911
912// These are utilities for IsMember and other transforming objects
913
916
918template <typename T, typename Enable = void> struct element_type { using type = T; };
919
920template <typename T> struct element_type<T, typename std::enable_if<is_copyable_ptr<T>::value>::type> {
921 using type = typename std::pointer_traits<T>::element_type;
922};
923
926template <typename T> struct element_value_type { using type = typename element_type<T>::type::value_type; };
927
929template <typename T, typename _ = void> struct pair_adaptor : std::false_type {
930 using value_type = typename T::value_type;
931 using first_type = typename std::remove_const<value_type>::type;
932 using second_type = typename std::remove_const<value_type>::type;
933
935 template <typename Q> static auto first(Q &&pair_value) -> decltype(std::forward<Q>(pair_value)) {
936 return std::forward<Q>(pair_value);
937 }
939 template <typename Q> static auto second(Q &&pair_value) -> decltype(std::forward<Q>(pair_value)) {
940 return std::forward<Q>(pair_value);
941 }
942};
943
946template <typename T>
947struct pair_adaptor<
948 T,
949 conditional_t<false, void_t<typename T::value_type::first_type, typename T::value_type::second_type>, void>>
950 : std::true_type {
951 using value_type = typename T::value_type;
952 using first_type = typename std::remove_const<typename value_type::first_type>::type;
953 using second_type = typename std::remove_const<typename value_type::second_type>::type;
954
956 template <typename Q> static auto first(Q &&pair_value) -> decltype(std::get<0>(std::forward<Q>(pair_value))) {
957 return std::get<0>(std::forward<Q>(pair_value));
958 }
960 template <typename Q> static auto second(Q &&pair_value) -> decltype(std::get<1>(std::forward<Q>(pair_value))) {
961 return std::get<1>(std::forward<Q>(pair_value));
962 }
963};
964
965// Warning is suppressed due to "bug" in gcc<5.0 and gcc 7.0 with c++17 enabled that generates a Wnarrowing warning
966// in the unevaluated context even if the function that was using this wasn't used. The standard says narrowing in
967// brace initialization shouldn't be allowed but for backwards compatibility gcc allows it in some contexts. It is a
968// little fuzzy what happens in template constructs and I think that was something GCC took a little while to work out.
969// But regardless some versions of gcc generate a warning when they shouldn't from the following code so that should be
970// suppressed
971#ifdef __GNUC__
972#pragma GCC diagnostic push
973#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wnarrowing"
974#endif
975// check for constructibility from a specific type and copy assignable used in the parse detection
976template <typename T, typename C> class is_direct_constructible {
977 template <typename TT, typename CC>
978 static auto test(int, std::true_type) -> decltype(
979// NVCC warns about narrowing conversions here
980#ifdef __CUDACC__
981#pragma diag_suppress 2361
982#endif
983 TT { std::declval<CC>() }
984#ifdef __CUDACC__
985#pragma diag_default 2361
986#endif
987 ,
988 std::is_move_assignable<TT>());
989
990 template <typename TT, typename CC> static auto test(int, std::false_type) -> std::false_type;
991
992 template <typename, typename> static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
993
994 public:
995 static constexpr bool value = decltype(test<T, C>(0, typename std::is_constructible<T, C>::type()))::value;
996};
997#ifdef __GNUC__
998#pragma GCC diagnostic pop
999#endif
1000
1001// Check for output streamability
1002// Based on https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22758291/how-can-i-detect-if-a-type-can-be-streamed-to-an-stdostream
1003
1004template <typename T, typename S = std::ostringstream> class is_ostreamable {
1005 template <typename TT, typename SS>
1006 static auto test(int) -> decltype(std::declval<SS &>() << std::declval<TT>(), std::true_type());
1007
1008 template <typename, typename> static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1009
1010 public:
1011 static constexpr bool value = decltype(test<T, S>(0))::value;
1012};
1013
1015template <typename T, typename S = std::istringstream> class is_istreamable {
1016 template <typename TT, typename SS>
1017 static auto test(int) -> decltype(std::declval<SS &>() >> std::declval<TT &>(), std::true_type());
1018
1019 template <typename, typename> static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1020
1021 public:
1022 static constexpr bool value = decltype(test<T, S>(0))::value;
1023};
1024
1026template <typename T, enable_if_t<is_istreamable<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1027bool from_stream(const std::string &istring, T &obj) {
1028 std::istringstream is;
1029 is.str(istring);
1030 is >> obj;
1031 return !is.fail() && !is.rdbuf()->in_avail();
1032}
1033
1034template <typename T, enable_if_t<!is_istreamable<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1035bool from_stream(const std::string & /*istring*/, T & /*obj*/) {
1036 return false;
1037}
1038
1039// Check for tuple like types, as in classes with a tuple_size type trait
1040template <typename S> class is_tuple_like {
1041 template <typename SS>
1042 // static auto test(int)
1043 // -> decltype(std::conditional<(std::tuple_size<SS>::value > 0), std::true_type, std::false_type>::type());
1044 static auto test(int) -> decltype(std::tuple_size<SS>::value, std::true_type{});
1045 template <typename> static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1046
1047 public:
1048 static constexpr bool value = decltype(test<S>(0))::value;
1049};
1050
1052template <typename T, enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1053auto to_string(T &&value) -> decltype(std::forward<T>(value)) {
1054 return std::forward<T>(value);
1055}
1056
1058template <typename T,
1059 enable_if_t<!std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value && is_ostreamable<T>::value, detail::enabler> =
1060 detail::dummy>
1061std::string to_string(T &&value) {
1062 std::stringstream stream;
1063 stream << value;
1064 return stream.str();
1065}
1066
1068template <typename T,
1069 enable_if_t<!std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value && !is_ostreamable<T>::value &&
1070 !is_vector<typename std::remove_reference<typename std::remove_const<T>::type>::type>::value,
1071 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1072std::string to_string(T &&) {
1073 return std::string{};
1074}
1075
1077template <typename T,
1078 enable_if_t<!std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value && !is_ostreamable<T>::value &&
1079 is_vector<typename std::remove_reference<typename std::remove_const<T>::type>::type>::value,
1080 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1081std::string to_string(T &&variable) {
1082 std::vector<std::string> defaults;
1083 defaults.reserve(variable.size());
1084 auto cval = variable.begin();
1085 auto end = variable.end();
1086 while(cval != end) {
1087 defaults.emplace_back(CLI::detail::to_string(*cval));
1088 ++cval;
1089 }
1090 return std::string("[" + detail::join(defaults) + "]");
1091}
1092
1094template <typename T1,
1095 typename T2,
1096 typename T,
1097 enable_if_t<std::is_same<T1, T2>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1098auto checked_to_string(T &&value) -> decltype(to_string(std::forward<T>(value))) {
1099 return to_string(std::forward<T>(value));
1100}
1101
1103template <typename T1,
1104 typename T2,
1105 typename T,
1106 enable_if_t<!std::is_same<T1, T2>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1107std::string checked_to_string(T &&) {
1108 return std::string{};
1109}
1111template <typename T, enable_if_t<std::is_arithmetic<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1112std::string value_string(const T &value) {
1113 return std::to_string(value);
1114}
1116template <typename T, enable_if_t<std::is_enum<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1117std::string value_string(const T &value) {
1118 return std::to_string(static_cast<typename std::underlying_type<T>::type>(value));
1119}
1121template <typename T,
1122 enable_if_t<!std::is_enum<T>::value && !std::is_arithmetic<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1123auto value_string(const T &value) -> decltype(to_string(value)) {
1124 return to_string(value);
1125}
1126
1128template <typename T, typename Enable = void> struct type_count { static const int value{0}; };
1129
1131template <typename T> struct type_count<T, typename std::enable_if<is_tuple_like<T>::value>::type> {
1132 static constexpr int value{std::tuple_size<T>::value};
1133};
1135template <typename T>
1136struct type_count<
1137 T,
1138 typename std::enable_if<!is_vector<T>::value && !is_tuple_like<T>::value && !std::is_void<T>::value>::type> {
1139 static constexpr int value{1};
1140};
1141
1143template <typename T> struct type_count<T, typename std::enable_if<is_vector<T>::value>::type> {
1144 static constexpr int value{is_vector<typename T::value_type>::value ? expected_max_vector_size
1145 : type_count<typename T::value_type>::value};
1146};
1147
1149template <typename T, typename Enable = void> struct expected_count { static const int value{0}; };
1150
1152template <typename T>
1153struct expected_count<T, typename std::enable_if<!is_vector<T>::value && !std::is_void<T>::value>::type> {
1154 static constexpr int value{1};
1155};
1157template <typename T> struct expected_count<T, typename std::enable_if<is_vector<T>::value>::type> {
1158 static constexpr int value{expected_max_vector_size};
1159};
1160
1161// Enumeration of the different supported categorizations of objects
1162enum class object_category : int {
1163 integral_value = 2,
1164 unsigned_integral = 4,
1165 enumeration = 6,
1166 boolean_value = 8,
1167 floating_point = 10,
1168 number_constructible = 12,
1169 double_constructible = 14,
1170 integer_constructible = 16,
1171 vector_value = 30,
1172 tuple_value = 35,
1173 // string assignable or greater used in a condition so anything string like must come last
1174 string_assignable = 50,
1175 string_constructible = 60,
1176 other = 200,
1177
1178};
1179
1181template <typename T, typename Enable = void> struct classify_object {
1182 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::other};
1183};
1184
1186template <typename T>
1187struct classify_object<T,
1188 typename std::enable_if<std::is_integral<T>::value && std::is_signed<T>::value &&
1189 !is_bool<T>::value && !std::is_enum<T>::value>::type> {
1190 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::integral_value};
1191};
1192
1194template <typename T>
1195struct classify_object<
1196 T,
1197 typename std::enable_if<std::is_integral<T>::value && std::is_unsigned<T>::value && !is_bool<T>::value>::type> {
1198 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::unsigned_integral};
1199};
1200
1202template <typename T> struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<is_bool<T>::value>::type> {
1203 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::boolean_value};
1204};
1205
1207template <typename T> struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<std::is_floating_point<T>::value>::type> {
1208 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::floating_point};
1209};
1210
1212template <typename T>
1213struct classify_object<
1214 T,
1215 typename std::enable_if<!std::is_floating_point<T>::value && !std::is_integral<T>::value &&
1216 std::is_assignable<T &, std::string>::value && !is_vector<T>::value>::type> {
1217 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::string_assignable};
1218};
1219
1221template <typename T>
1222struct classify_object<
1223 T,
1224 typename std::enable_if<!std::is_floating_point<T>::value && !std::is_integral<T>::value &&
1225 !std::is_assignable<T &, std::string>::value &&
1226 std::is_constructible<T, std::string>::value && !is_vector<T>::value>::type> {
1227 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::string_constructible};
1228};
1229
1231template <typename T> struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<std::is_enum<T>::value>::type> {
1232 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::enumeration};
1233};
1234
1237template <typename T> struct uncommon_type {
1238 using type = typename std::conditional<!std::is_floating_point<T>::value && !std::is_integral<T>::value &&
1239 !std::is_assignable<T &, std::string>::value &&
1240 !std::is_constructible<T, std::string>::value && !is_vector<T>::value &&
1241 !std::is_enum<T>::value,
1242 std::true_type,
1243 std::false_type>::type;
1244 static constexpr bool value = type::value;
1245};
1246
1248template <typename T>
1249struct classify_object<T,
1250 typename std::enable_if<uncommon_type<T>::value && type_count<T>::value == 1 &&
1251 is_direct_constructible<T, double>::value &&
1252 is_direct_constructible<T, int>::value>::type> {
1253 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::number_constructible};
1254};
1255
1257template <typename T>
1258struct classify_object<T,
1259 typename std::enable_if<uncommon_type<T>::value && type_count<T>::value == 1 &&
1260 !is_direct_constructible<T, double>::value &&
1261 is_direct_constructible<T, int>::value>::type> {
1262 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::integer_constructible};
1263};
1264
1266template <typename T>
1267struct classify_object<T,
1268 typename std::enable_if<uncommon_type<T>::value && type_count<T>::value == 1 &&
1269 is_direct_constructible<T, double>::value &&
1270 !is_direct_constructible<T, int>::value>::type> {
1271 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::double_constructible};
1272};
1273
1275template <typename T>
1276struct classify_object<T,
1277 typename std::enable_if<(type_count<T>::value >= 2 && !is_vector<T>::value) ||
1278 (is_tuple_like<T>::value && uncommon_type<T>::value &&
1279 !is_direct_constructible<T, double>::value &&
1280 !is_direct_constructible<T, int>::value)>::type> {
1281 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::tuple_value};
1282};
1283
1285template <typename T> struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<is_vector<T>::value>::type> {
1286 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::vector_value};
1287};
1288
1289// Type name print
1290
1294
1295template <typename T,
1296 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::integral_value ||
1297 classify_object<T>::value == object_category::integer_constructible,
1298 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1299constexpr const char *type_name() {
1300 return "INT";
1301}
1302
1303template <typename T,
1304 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::unsigned_integral, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1305constexpr const char *type_name() {
1306 return "UINT";
1307}
1308
1309template <typename T,
1310 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::floating_point ||
1311 classify_object<T>::value == object_category::number_constructible ||
1312 classify_object<T>::value == object_category::double_constructible,
1313 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1314constexpr const char *type_name() {
1315 return "FLOAT";
1316}
1317
1319template <typename T,
1320 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::enumeration, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1321constexpr const char *type_name() {
1322 return "ENUM";
1323}
1324
1326template <typename T,
1327 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::boolean_value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1328constexpr const char *type_name() {
1329 return "BOOLEAN";
1330}
1331
1333template <typename T,
1334 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value >= object_category::string_assignable, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1335constexpr const char *type_name() {
1336 return "TEXT";
1337}
1338
1340template <typename T,
1341 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::tuple_value && type_count<T>::value == 1,
1342 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1343inline std::string type_name() {
1344 return type_name<typename std::tuple_element<0, T>::type>();
1345}
1346
1348template <typename T, std::size_t I>
1349inline typename std::enable_if<I == type_count<T>::value, std::string>::type tuple_name() {
1350 return std::string{};
1351}
1352
1354template <typename T, std::size_t I>
1355 inline typename std::enable_if < I<type_count<T>::value, std::string>::type tuple_name() {
1356 std::string str = std::string(type_name<typename std::tuple_element<I, T>::type>()) + ',' + tuple_name<T, I + 1>();
1357 if(str.back() == ',')
1358 str.pop_back();
1359 return str;
1360}
1361
1363template <typename T,
1364 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::tuple_value && type_count<T>::value >= 2,
1365 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1366std::string type_name() {
1367 auto tname = std::string(1, '[') + tuple_name<T, 0>();
1368 tname.push_back(']');
1369 return tname;
1370}
1371
1373template <typename T,
1374 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::vector_value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1375inline std::string type_name() {
1376 return type_name<typename T::value_type>();
1377}
1378
1379// Lexical cast
1380
1382inline int64_t to_flag_value(std::string val) {
1383 static const std::string trueString("true");
1384 static const std::string falseString("false");
1385 if(val == trueString) {
1386 return 1;
1387 }
1388 if(val == falseString) {
1389 return -1;
1390 }
1391 val = detail::to_lower(val);
1392 int64_t ret;
1393 if(val.size() == 1) {
1394 if(val[0] >= '1' && val[0] <= '9') {
1395 return (static_cast<int64_t>(val[0]) - '0');
1396 }
1397 switch(val[0]) {
1398 case '0':
1399 case 'f':
1400 case 'n':
1401 case '-':
1402 ret = -1;
1403 break;
1404 case 't':
1405 case 'y':
1406 case '+':
1407 ret = 1;
1408 break;
1409 default:
1410 throw std::invalid_argument("unrecognized character");
1411 }
1412 return ret;
1413 }
1414 if(val == trueString || val == "on" || val == "yes" || val == "enable") {
1415 ret = 1;
1416 } else if(val == falseString || val == "off" || val == "no" || val == "disable") {
1417 ret = -1;
1418 } else {
1419 ret = std::stoll(val);
1420 }
1421 return ret;
1422}
1423
1425template <typename T,
1426 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::integral_value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1427bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1428 try {
1429 std::size_t n = 0;
1430 std::int64_t output_ll = std::stoll(input, &n, 0);
1431 output = static_cast<T>(output_ll);
1432 return n == input.size() && static_cast<std::int64_t>(output) == output_ll;
1433 } catch(const std::invalid_argument &) {
1434 return false;
1435 } catch(const std::out_of_range &) {
1436 return false;
1437 }
1438}
1439
1441template <typename T,
1442 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::unsigned_integral, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1443bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1444 if(!input.empty() && input.front() == '-')
1445 return false; // std::stoull happily converts negative values to junk without any errors.
1446
1447 try {
1448 std::size_t n = 0;
1449 std::uint64_t output_ll = std::stoull(input, &n, 0);
1450 output = static_cast<T>(output_ll);
1451 return n == input.size() && static_cast<std::uint64_t>(output) == output_ll;
1452 } catch(const std::invalid_argument &) {
1453 return false;
1454 } catch(const std::out_of_range &) {
1455 return false;
1456 }
1457}
1458
1460template <typename T,
1461 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::boolean_value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1462bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1463 try {
1464 auto out = to_flag_value(input);
1465 output = (out > 0);
1466 return true;
1467 } catch(const std::invalid_argument &) {
1468 return false;
1469 } catch(const std::out_of_range &) {
1470 // if the number is out of the range of a 64 bit value then it is still a number and for this purpose is still
1471 // valid all we care about the sign
1472 output = (input[0] != '-');
1473 return true;
1474 }
1475}
1476
1478template <typename T,
1479 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::floating_point, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1480bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1481 try {
1482 std::size_t n = 0;
1483 output = static_cast<T>(std::stold(input, &n));
1484 return n == input.size();
1485 } catch(const std::invalid_argument &) {
1486 return false;
1487 } catch(const std::out_of_range &) {
1488 return false;
1489 }
1490}
1491
1493template <typename T,
1494 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::string_assignable, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1495bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1496 output = input;
1497 return true;
1498}
1499
1501template <
1502 typename T,
1503 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::string_constructible, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1504bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1505 output = T(input);
1506 return true;
1507}
1508
1510template <typename T,
1511 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::enumeration, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1512bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1513 typename std::underlying_type<T>::type val;
1514 bool retval = detail::lexical_cast(input, val);
1515 if(!retval) {
1516 return false;
1517 }
1518 output = static_cast<T>(val);
1519 return true;
1520}
1521
1523template <
1524 typename T,
1525 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::number_constructible, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1526bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1527 int val;
1528 if(lexical_cast(input, val)) {
1529 output = T(val);
1530 return true;
1531 } else {
1532 double dval;
1533 if(lexical_cast(input, dval)) {
1534 output = T{dval};
1535 return true;
1536 }
1537 }
1538 return from_stream(input, output);
1539}
1540
1542template <
1543 typename T,
1544 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::integer_constructible, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1545bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1546 int val;
1547 if(lexical_cast(input, val)) {
1548 output = T(val);
1549 return true;
1550 }
1551 return from_stream(input, output);
1552}
1553
1555template <
1556 typename T,
1557 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::double_constructible, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1558bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1559 double val;
1560 if(lexical_cast(input, val)) {
1561 output = T{val};
1562 return true;
1563 }
1564 return from_stream(input, output);
1565}
1566
1568template <typename T, enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::other, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1569bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1570 static_assert(is_istreamable<T>::value,
1571 "option object type must have a lexical cast overload or streaming input operator(>>) defined, if it "
1572 "is convertible from another type use the add_option<T, XC>(...) with XC being the known type");
1573 return from_stream(input, output);
1574}
1575
1577template <
1578 typename T,
1579 typename XC,
1580 enable_if_t<std::is_same<T, XC>::value && (classify_object<T>::value == object_category::string_assignable ||
1581 classify_object<T>::value == object_category::string_constructible),
1582 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1583bool lexical_assign(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1584 return lexical_cast(input, output);
1585}
1586
1588template <typename T,
1589 typename XC,
1590 enable_if_t<std::is_same<T, XC>::value && classify_object<T>::value != object_category::string_assignable &&
1591 classify_object<T>::value != object_category::string_constructible,
1592 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1593bool lexical_assign(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1594 if(input.empty()) {
1595 output = T{};
1596 return true;
1597 }
1598 return lexical_cast(input, output);
1599}
1600
1602template <
1603 typename T,
1604 typename XC,
1605 enable_if_t<!std::is_same<T, XC>::value && std::is_assignable<T &, XC &>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1606bool lexical_assign(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1607 XC val{};
1608 bool parse_result = (!input.empty()) ? lexical_cast<XC>(input, val) : true;
1609 if(parse_result) {
1610 output = val;
1611 }
1612 return parse_result;
1613}
1614
1616template <typename T,
1617 typename XC,
1618 enable_if_t<!std::is_same<T, XC>::value && !std::is_assignable<T &, XC &>::value &&
1619 std::is_move_assignable<T>::value,
1620 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1621bool lexical_assign(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1622 XC val{};
1623 bool parse_result = input.empty() ? true : lexical_cast<XC>(input, val);
1624 if(parse_result) {
1625 output = T(val); // use () form of constructor to allow some implicit conversions
1626 }
1627 return parse_result;
1628}
1630template <
1631 typename T,
1632 typename XC,
1633 enable_if_t<!is_tuple_like<T>::value && !is_tuple_like<XC>::value && !is_vector<T>::value && !is_vector<XC>::value,
1634 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1635bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, T &output) {
1636 return lexical_assign<T, XC>(strings[0], output);
1637}
1638
1640template <typename T,
1641 typename XC,
1642 enable_if_t<type_count<T>::value == 1 && type_count<XC>::value == 2, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1643bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, T &output) {
1644 typename std::tuple_element<0, XC>::type v1;
1645 typename std::tuple_element<1, XC>::type v2;
1646 bool retval = lexical_assign<decltype(v1), decltype(v1)>(strings[0], v1);
1647 if(strings.size() > 1) {
1648 retval = retval && lexical_assign<decltype(v2), decltype(v2)>(strings[1], v2);
1649 }
1650 if(retval) {
1651 output = T{v1, v2};
1652 }
1653 return retval;
1654}
1655
1657template <class T,
1658 class XC,
1659 enable_if_t<expected_count<T>::value == expected_max_vector_size &&
1660 expected_count<XC>::value == expected_max_vector_size && type_count<XC>::value == 1,
1661 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1662bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, T &output) {
1663 output.clear();
1664 output.reserve(strings.size());
1665 for(const auto &elem : strings) {
1666
1667 output.emplace_back();
1668 bool retval = lexical_assign<typename T::value_type, typename XC::value_type>(elem, output.back());
1669 if(!retval) {
1670 return false;
1671 }
1672 }
1673 return (!output.empty());
1674}
1675
1677template <class T,
1678 class XC,
1679 enable_if_t<expected_count<T>::value == expected_max_vector_size &&
1680 expected_count<XC>::value == expected_max_vector_size && type_count<XC>::value == 2,
1681 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1682bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, T &output) {
1683 output.clear();
1684 for(std::size_t ii = 0; ii < strings.size(); ii += 2) {
1685
1686 typename std::tuple_element<0, typename XC::value_type>::type v1;
1687 typename std::tuple_element<1, typename XC::value_type>::type v2;
1688 bool retval = lexical_assign<decltype(v1), decltype(v1)>(strings[ii], v1);
1689 if(strings.size() > ii + 1) {
1690 retval = retval && lexical_assign<decltype(v2), decltype(v2)>(strings[ii + 1], v2);
1691 }
1692 if(retval) {
1693 output.emplace_back(v1, v2);
1694 } else {
1695 return false;
1696 }
1697 }
1698 return (!output.empty());
1699}
1700
1702template <class T,
1703 class XC,
1704 enable_if_t<(expected_count<T>::value == expected_max_vector_size) && (expected_count<XC>::value == 1) &&
1705 (type_count<XC>::value == 1),
1706 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1707bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, T &output) {
1708 bool retval = true;
1709 output.clear();
1710 output.reserve(strings.size());
1711 for(const auto &elem : strings) {
1712
1713 output.emplace_back();
1714 retval = retval && lexical_assign<typename T::value_type, XC>(elem, output.back());
1715 }
1716 return (!output.empty()) && retval;
1717}
1718// This one is last since it can call other lexical_conversion functions
1720template <typename T,
1721 typename XC,
1722 enable_if_t<!is_tuple_like<T>::value && !is_vector<T>::value && is_vector<XC>::value, detail::enabler> =
1723 detail::dummy>
1724bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, T &output) {
1725
1726 if(strings.size() > 1 || (!strings.empty() && !(strings.front().empty()))) {
1727 XC val;
1728 auto retval = lexical_conversion<XC, XC>(strings, val);
1729 output = T{val};
1730 return retval;
1731 }
1732 output = T{};
1733 return true;
1734}
1735
1737template <class T, class XC, std::size_t I>
1738inline typename std::enable_if<I >= type_count<T>::value, bool>::type tuple_conversion(const std::vector<std::string> &,
1739 T &) {
1740 return true;
1741}
1743template <class T, class XC, std::size_t I>
1744 inline typename std::enable_if <
1745 I<type_count<T>::value, bool>::type tuple_conversion(const std::vector<std::string> &strings, T &output) {
1746 bool retval = true;
1747 if(strings.size() > I) {
1748 retval = retval && lexical_assign<typename std::tuple_element<I, T>::type,
1749 typename std::conditional<is_tuple_like<XC>::value,
1750 typename std::tuple_element<I, XC>::type,
1751 XC>::type>(strings[I], std::get<I>(output));
1752 }
1753 retval = retval && tuple_conversion<T, XC, I + 1>(strings, output);
1754 return retval;
1755}
1756
1758template <class T, class XC, enable_if_t<is_tuple_like<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1759bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, T &output) {
1760 static_assert(
1761 !is_tuple_like<XC>::value || type_count<T>::value == type_count<XC>::value,
1762 "if the conversion type is defined as a tuple it must be the same size as the type you are converting to");
1763 return tuple_conversion<T, XC, 0>(strings, output);
1764}
1765
1767template <class T,
1768 class XC,
1769 enable_if_t<expected_count<T>::value == expected_max_vector_size &&
1770 expected_count<XC>::value == expected_max_vector_size && (type_count<XC>::value > 2),
1771 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1772bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, T &output) {
1773 bool retval = true;
1774 output.clear();
1775 std::vector<std::string> temp;
1776 std::size_t ii = 0;
1777 std::size_t icount = 0;
1778 std::size_t xcm = type_count<XC>::value;
1779 while(ii < strings.size()) {
1780 temp.push_back(strings[ii]);
1781 ++ii;
1782 ++icount;
1783 if(icount == xcm || temp.back().empty()) {
1784 if(static_cast<int>(xcm) == expected_max_vector_size) {
1785 temp.pop_back();
1786 }
1787 output.emplace_back();
1788 retval = retval && lexical_conversion<typename T::value_type, typename XC::value_type>(temp, output.back());
1789 temp.clear();
1790 if(!retval) {
1791 return false;
1792 }
1793 icount = 0;
1794 }
1795 }
1796 return retval;
1797}
1803template <typename T,
1804 enable_if_t<std::is_integral<T>::value && std::is_unsigned<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1805void sum_flag_vector(const std::vector<std::string> &flags, T &output) {
1806 int64_t count{0};
1807 for(auto &flag : flags) {
1808 count += detail::to_flag_value(flag);
1809 }
1810 output = (count > 0) ? static_cast<T>(count) : T{0};
1811}
1812
1818template <typename T,
1819 enable_if_t<std::is_integral<T>::value && std::is_signed<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1820void sum_flag_vector(const std::vector<std::string> &flags, T &output) {
1821 int64_t count{0};
1822 for(auto &flag : flags) {
1823 count += detail::to_flag_value(flag);
1824 }
1825 output = static_cast<T>(count);
1826}
1827
1828} // namespace detail
1829} // namespace CLI
1830
1831// From CLI/Split.hpp:
1832
1833namespace CLI {
1834namespace detail {
1835
1836// Returns false if not a short option. Otherwise, sets opt name and rest and returns true
1837inline bool split_short(const std::string &current, std::string &name, std::string &rest) {
1838 if(current.size() > 1 && current[0] == '-' && valid_first_char(current[1])) {
1839 name = current.substr(1, 1);
1840 rest = current.substr(2);
1841 return true;
1842 }
1843 return false;
1844}
1845
1846// Returns false if not a long option. Otherwise, sets opt name and other side of = and returns true
1847inline bool split_long(const std::string &current, std::string &name, std::string &value) {
1848 if(current.size() > 2 && current.substr(0, 2) == "--" && valid_first_char(current[2])) {
1849 auto loc = current.find_first_of('=');
1850 if(loc != std::string::npos) {
1851 name = current.substr(2, loc - 2);
1852 value = current.substr(loc + 1);
1853 } else {
1854 name = current.substr(2);
1855 value = "";
1856 }
1857 return true;
1858 }
1859 return false;
1860}
1861
1862// Returns false if not a windows style option. Otherwise, sets opt name and value and returns true
1863inline bool split_windows_style(const std::string &current, std::string &name, std::string &value) {
1864 if(current.size() > 1 && current[0] == '/' && valid_first_char(current[1])) {
1865 auto loc = current.find_first_of(':');
1866 if(loc != std::string::npos) {
1867 name = current.substr(1, loc - 1);
1868 value = current.substr(loc + 1);
1869 } else {
1870 name = current.substr(1);
1871 value = "";
1872 }
1873 return true;
1874 }
1875 return false;
1876}
1877
1878// Splits a string into multiple long and short names
1879inline std::vector<std::string> split_names(std::string current) {
1880 std::vector<std::string> output;
1881 std::size_t val;
1882 while((val = current.find(",")) != std::string::npos) {
1883 output.push_back(trim_copy(current.substr(0, val)));
1884 current = current.substr(val + 1);
1885 }
1886 output.push_back(trim_copy(current));
1887 return output;
1888}
1889
1891inline std::vector<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> get_default_flag_values(const std::string &str) {
1892 std::vector<std::string> flags = split_names(str);
1893 flags.erase(std::remove_if(flags.begin(),
1894 flags.end(),
1895 [](const std::string &name) {
1896 return ((name.empty()) || (!(((name.find_first_of('{') != std::string::npos) &&
1897 (name.back() == '}')) ||
1898 (name[0] == '!'))));
1899 }),
1900 flags.end());
1901 std::vector<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> output;
1902 output.reserve(flags.size());
1903 for(auto &flag : flags) {
1904 auto def_start = flag.find_first_of('{');
1905 std::string defval = "false";
1906 if((def_start != std::string::npos) && (flag.back() == '}')) {
1907 defval = flag.substr(def_start + 1);
1908 defval.pop_back();
1909 flag.erase(def_start, std::string::npos);
1910 }
1911 flag.erase(0, flag.find_first_not_of("-!"));
1912 output.emplace_back(flag, defval);
1913 }
1914 return output;
1915}
1916
1918inline std::tuple<std::vector<std::string>, std::vector<std::string>, std::string>
1919get_names(const std::vector<std::string> &input) {
1920
1921 std::vector<std::string> short_names;
1922 std::vector<std::string> long_names;
1923 std::string pos_name;
1924
1925 for(std::string name : input) {
1926 if(name.length() == 0) {
1927 continue;
1928 }
1929 if(name.length() > 1 && name[0] == '-' && name[1] != '-') {
1930 if(name.length() == 2 && valid_first_char(name[1]))
1931 short_names.emplace_back(1, name[1]);
1932 else
1933 throw BadNameString::OneCharName(name);
1934 } else if(name.length() > 2 && name.substr(0, 2) == "--") {
1935 name = name.substr(2);
1936 if(valid_name_string(name))
1937 long_names.push_back(name);
1938 else
1939 throw BadNameString::BadLongName(name);
1940 } else if(name == "-" || name == "--") {
1941 throw BadNameString::DashesOnly(name);
1942 } else {
1943 if(pos_name.length() > 0)
1944 throw BadNameString::MultiPositionalNames(name);
1945 pos_name = name;
1946 }
1947 }
1948
1949 return std::tuple<std::vector<std::string>, std::vector<std::string>, std::string>(
1950 short_names, long_names, pos_name);
1951}
1952
1953} // namespace detail
1954} // namespace CLI
1955
1956// From CLI/ConfigFwd.hpp:
1957
1958namespace CLI {
1959
1960class App;
1961
1963struct ConfigItem {
1965 std::vector<std::string> parents{};
1966
1968 std::string name{};
1969
1971 std::vector<std::string> inputs{};
1972
1974 std::string fullname() const {
1975 std::vector<std::string> tmp = parents;
1976 tmp.emplace_back(name);
1977 return detail::join(tmp, ".");
1978 }
1979};
1980
1982class Config {
1983 protected:
1984 std::vector<ConfigItem> items{};
1985
1986 public:
1988 virtual std::string to_config(const App *, bool, bool, std::string) const = 0;
1989
1991 virtual std::vector<ConfigItem> from_config(std::istream &) const = 0;
1992
1994 virtual std::string to_flag(const ConfigItem &item) const {
1995 if(item.inputs.size() == 1) {
1996 return item.inputs.at(0);
1997 }
1998 throw ConversionError::TooManyInputsFlag(item.fullname());
1999 }
2000
2002 std::vector<ConfigItem> from_file(const std::string &name) {
2003 std::ifstream input{name};
2004 if(!input.good())
2005 throw FileError::Missing(name);
2006
2007 return from_config(input);
2008 }
2009
2011 virtual ~Config() = default;
2012};
2013
2015class ConfigBase : public Config {
2016 protected:
2018 char commentChar = ';';
2020 char arrayStart = '\0';
2022 char arrayEnd = '\0';
2024 char arraySeparator = ' ';
2026 char valueDelimiter = '=';
2027
2028 public:
2029 std::string
2030 to_config(const App * /*app*/, bool default_also, bool write_description, std::string prefix) const override;
2031
2032 std::vector<ConfigItem> from_config(std::istream &input) const override;
2034 ConfigBase *comment(char cchar) {
2035 commentChar = cchar;
2036 return this;
2037 }
2039 ConfigBase *arrayBounds(char aStart, char aEnd) {
2040 arrayStart = aStart;
2041 arrayEnd = aEnd;
2042 return this;
2043 }
2045 ConfigBase *arrayDelimiter(char aSep) {
2046 arraySeparator = aSep;
2047 return this;
2048 }
2050 ConfigBase *valueSeparator(char vSep) {
2051 valueDelimiter = vSep;
2052 return this;
2053 }
2054};
2055
2057using ConfigINI = ConfigBase;
2058
2060class ConfigTOML : public ConfigINI {
2061
2062 public:
2063 ConfigTOML() {
2064 commentChar = '#';
2065 arrayStart = '[';
2066 arrayEnd = ']';
2067 arraySeparator = ',';
2068 valueDelimiter = '=';
2069 }
2070};
2071} // namespace CLI
2072
2073// From CLI/Validators.hpp:
2074
2075namespace CLI {
2076
2077class Option;
2078
2080
2087
2089class Validator {
2090 protected:
2092 std::function<std::string()> desc_function_{[]() { return std::string{}; }};
2093
2096 std::function<std::string(std::string &)> func_{[](std::string &) { return std::string{}; }};
2098 std::string name_{};
2100 int application_index_ = -1;
2102 bool active_{true};
2104 bool non_modifying_{false};
2105
2106 public:
2107 Validator() = default;
2109 explicit Validator(std::string validator_desc) : desc_function_([validator_desc]() { return validator_desc; }) {}
2111 Validator(std::function<std::string(std::string &)> op, std::string validator_desc, std::string validator_name = "")
2112 : desc_function_([validator_desc]() { return validator_desc; }), func_(std::move(op)),
2113 name_(std::move(validator_name)) {}
2115 Validator &operation(std::function<std::string(std::string &)> op) {
2116 func_ = std::move(op);
2117 return *this;
2118 }
2121 std::string operator()(std::string &str) const {
2122 std::string retstring;
2123 if(active_) {
2124 if(non_modifying_) {
2125 std::string value = str;
2126 retstring = func_(value);
2127 } else {
2128 retstring = func_(str);
2129 }
2130 }
2131 return retstring;
2132 };
2133
2136 std::string operator()(const std::string &str) const {
2137 std::string value = str;
2138 return (active_) ? func_(value) : std::string{};
2139 };
2140
2142 Validator &description(std::string validator_desc) {
2143 desc_function_ = [validator_desc]() { return validator_desc; };
2144 return *this;
2145 }
2147 Validator description(std::string validator_desc) const {
2148 Validator newval(*this);
2149 newval.desc_function_ = [validator_desc]() { return validator_desc; };
2150 return newval;
2151 }
2153 std::string get_description() const {
2154 if(active_) {
2155 return desc_function_();
2156 }
2157 return std::string{};
2158 }
2160 Validator &name(std::string validator_name) {
2161 name_ = std::move(validator_name);
2162 return *this;
2163 }
2165 Validator name(std::string validator_name) const {
2166 Validator newval(*this);
2167 newval.name_ = std::move(validator_name);
2168 return newval;
2169 }
2171 const std::string &get_name() const { return name_; }
2173 Validator &active(bool active_val = true) {
2174 active_ = active_val;
2175 return *this;
2176 }
2178 Validator active(bool active_val = true) const {
2179 Validator newval(*this);
2180 newval.active_ = active_val;
2181 return newval;
2182 }
2183
2185 Validator &non_modifying(bool no_modify = true) {
2186 non_modifying_ = no_modify;
2187 return *this;
2188 }
2190 Validator &application_index(int app_index) {
2191 application_index_ = app_index;
2192 return *this;
2193 };
2195 Validator application_index(int app_index) const {
2196 Validator newval(*this);
2197 newval.application_index_ = app_index;
2198 return newval;
2199 };
2201 int get_application_index() const { return application_index_; }
2203 bool get_active() const { return active_; }
2204
2206 bool get_modifying() const { return !non_modifying_; }
2207
2210 Validator operator&(const Validator &other) const {
2211 Validator newval;
2212
2213 newval._merge_description(*this, other, " AND ");
2214
2215 // Give references (will make a copy in lambda function)
2216 const std::function<std::string(std::string & filename)> &f1 = func_;
2217 const std::function<std::string(std::string & filename)> &f2 = other.func_;
2218
2219 newval.func_ = [f1, f2](std::string &input) {
2220 std::string s1 = f1(input);
2221 std::string s2 = f2(input);
2222 if(!s1.empty() && !s2.empty())
2223 return std::string("(") + s1 + ") AND (" + s2 + ")";
2224 else
2225 return s1 + s2;
2226 };
2227
2228 newval.active_ = (active_ & other.active_);
2229 newval.application_index_ = application_index_;
2230 return newval;
2231 }
2232
2235 Validator operator|(const Validator &other) const {
2236 Validator newval;
2237
2238 newval._merge_description(*this, other, " OR ");
2239
2240 // Give references (will make a copy in lambda function)
2241 const std::function<std::string(std::string &)> &f1 = func_;
2242 const std::function<std::string(std::string &)> &f2 = other.func_;
2243
2244 newval.func_ = [f1, f2](std::string &input) {
2245 std::string s1 = f1(input);
2246 std::string s2 = f2(input);
2247 if(s1.empty() || s2.empty())
2248 return std::string();
2249
2250 return std::string("(") + s1 + ") OR (" + s2 + ")";
2251 };
2252 newval.active_ = (active_ & other.active_);
2253 newval.application_index_ = application_index_;
2254 return newval;
2255 }
2256
2258 Validator operator!() const {
2259 Validator newval;
2260 const std::function<std::string()> &dfunc1 = desc_function_;
2261 newval.desc_function_ = [dfunc1]() {
2262 auto str = dfunc1();
2263 return (!str.empty()) ? std::string("NOT ") + str : std::string{};
2264 };
2265 // Give references (will make a copy in lambda function)
2266 const std::function<std::string(std::string & res)> &f1 = func_;
2267
2268 newval.func_ = [f1, dfunc1](std::string &test) -> std::string {
2269 std::string s1 = f1(test);
2270 if(s1.empty()) {
2271 return std::string("check ") + dfunc1() + " succeeded improperly";
2272 }
2273 return std::string{};
2274 };
2275 newval.active_ = active_;
2276 newval.application_index_ = application_index_;
2277 return newval;
2278 }
2279
2280 private:
2281 void _merge_description(const Validator &val1, const Validator &val2, const std::string &merger) {
2282
2283 const std::function<std::string()> &dfunc1 = val1.desc_function_;
2284 const std::function<std::string()> &dfunc2 = val2.desc_function_;
2285
2286 desc_function_ = [=]() {
2287 std::string f1 = dfunc1();
2288 std::string f2 = dfunc2();
2289 if((f1.empty()) || (f2.empty())) {
2290 return f1 + f2;
2291 }
2292 return std::string(1, '(') + f1 + ')' + merger + '(' + f2 + ')';
2293 };
2294 }
2295}; // namespace CLI
2296
2298class CustomValidator : public Validator {
2299 public:
2300};
2301// The implementation of the built in validators is using the Validator class;
2302// the user is only expected to use the const (static) versions (since there's no setup).
2303// Therefore, this is in detail.
2304namespace detail {
2305
2307enum class path_type { nonexistant, file, directory };
2308
2309#if defined CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM && CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM > 0
2311inline path_type check_path(const char *file) noexcept {
2312 std::error_code ec;
2313 auto stat = std::filesystem::status(file, ec);
2314 if(ec) {
2315 return path_type::nonexistant;
2316 }
2317 switch(stat.type()) {
2318 case std::filesystem::file_type::none:
2319 case std::filesystem::file_type::not_found:
2320 return path_type::nonexistant;
2321 case std::filesystem::file_type::directory:
2322 return path_type::directory;
2323 case std::filesystem::file_type::symlink:
2324 case std::filesystem::file_type::block:
2325 case std::filesystem::file_type::character:
2326 case std::filesystem::file_type::fifo:
2327 case std::filesystem::file_type::socket:
2328 case std::filesystem::file_type::regular:
2329 case std::filesystem::file_type::unknown:
2330 default:
2331 return path_type::file;
2332 }
2333}
2334#else
2336inline path_type check_path(const char *file) noexcept {
2337#if defined(_MSC_VER)
2338 struct __stat64 buffer;
2339 if(_stat64(file, &buffer) == 0) {
2340 return ((buffer.st_mode & S_IFDIR) != 0) ? path_type::directory : path_type::file;
2341 }
2342#else
2343 struct stat buffer;
2344 if(stat(file, &buffer) == 0) {
2345 return ((buffer.st_mode & S_IFDIR) != 0) ? path_type::directory : path_type::file;
2346 }
2347#endif
2348 return path_type::nonexistant;
2349}
2350#endif
2352class ExistingFileValidator : public Validator {
2353 public:
2354 ExistingFileValidator() : Validator("FILE") {
2355 func_ = [](std::string &filename) {
2356 auto path_result = check_path(filename.c_str());
2357 if(path_result == path_type::nonexistant) {
2358 return "File does not exist: " + filename;
2359 }
2360 if(path_result == path_type::directory) {
2361 return "File is actually a directory: " + filename;
2362 }
2363 return std::string();
2364 };
2365 }
2366};
2367
2369class ExistingDirectoryValidator : public Validator {
2370 public:
2371 ExistingDirectoryValidator() : Validator("DIR") {
2372 func_ = [](std::string &filename) {
2373 auto path_result = check_path(filename.c_str());
2374 if(path_result == path_type::nonexistant) {
2375 return "Directory does not exist: " + filename;
2376 }
2377 if(path_result == path_type::file) {
2378 return "Directory is actually a file: " + filename;
2379 }
2380 return std::string();
2381 };
2382 }
2383};
2384
2386class ExistingPathValidator : public Validator {
2387 public:
2388 ExistingPathValidator() : Validator("PATH(existing)") {
2389 func_ = [](std::string &filename) {
2390 auto path_result = check_path(filename.c_str());
2391 if(path_result == path_type::nonexistant) {
2392 return "Path does not exist: " + filename;
2393 }
2394 return std::string();
2395 };
2396 }
2397};
2398
2400class NonexistentPathValidator : public Validator {
2401 public:
2402 NonexistentPathValidator() : Validator("PATH(non-existing)") {
2403 func_ = [](std::string &filename) {
2404 auto path_result = check_path(filename.c_str());
2405 if(path_result != path_type::nonexistant) {
2406 return "Path already exists: " + filename;
2407 }
2408 return std::string();
2409 };
2410 }
2411};
2412
2414class IPV4Validator : public Validator {
2415 public:
2416 IPV4Validator() : Validator("IPV4") {
2417 func_ = [](std::string &ip_addr) {
2418 auto result = CLI::detail::split(ip_addr, '.');
2419 if(result.size() != 4) {
2420 return std::string("Invalid IPV4 address must have four parts (") + ip_addr + ')';
2421 }
2422 int num;
2423 for(const auto &var : result) {
2424 bool retval = detail::lexical_cast(var, num);
2425 if(!retval) {
2426 return std::string("Failed parsing number (") + var + ')';
2427 }
2428 if(num < 0 || num > 255) {
2429 return std::string("Each IP number must be between 0 and 255 ") + var;
2430 }
2431 }
2432 return std::string();
2433 };
2434 }
2435};
2436
2438class PositiveNumber : public Validator {
2439 public:
2440 PositiveNumber() : Validator("POSITIVE") {
2441 func_ = [](std::string &number_str) {
2442 double number;
2443 if(!detail::lexical_cast(number_str, number)) {
2444 return std::string("Failed parsing number: (") + number_str + ')';
2445 }
2446 if(number <= 0) {
2447 return std::string("Number less or equal to 0: (") + number_str + ')';
2448 }
2449 return std::string();
2450 };
2451 }
2452};
2454class NonNegativeNumber : public Validator {
2455 public:
2456 NonNegativeNumber() : Validator("NONNEGATIVE") {
2457 func_ = [](std::string &number_str) {
2458 double number;
2459 if(!detail::lexical_cast(number_str, number)) {
2460 return std::string("Failed parsing number: (") + number_str + ')';
2461 }
2462 if(number < 0) {
2463 return std::string("Number less than 0: (") + number_str + ')';
2464 }
2465 return std::string();
2466 };
2467 }
2468};
2469
2471class Number : public Validator {
2472 public:
2473 Number() : Validator("NUMBER") {
2474 func_ = [](std::string &number_str) {
2475 double number;
2476 if(!detail::lexical_cast(number_str, number)) {
2477 return std::string("Failed parsing as a number (") + number_str + ')';
2478 }
2479 return std::string();
2480 };
2481 }
2482};
2483
2484} // namespace detail
2485
2486// Static is not needed here, because global const implies static.
2487
2489const detail::ExistingFileValidator ExistingFile;
2490
2492const detail::ExistingDirectoryValidator ExistingDirectory;
2493
2495const detail::ExistingPathValidator ExistingPath;
2496
2498const detail::NonexistentPathValidator NonexistentPath;
2499
2501const detail::IPV4Validator ValidIPV4;
2502
2504const detail::PositiveNumber PositiveNumber;
2505
2507const detail::NonNegativeNumber NonNegativeNumber;
2508
2510const detail::Number Number;
2511
2513class Range : public Validator {
2514 public:
2519 template <typename T> Range(T min, T max) {
2520 std::stringstream out;
2521 out << detail::type_name<T>() << " in [" << min << " - " << max << "]";
2522 description(out.str());
2523
2524 func_ = [min, max](std::string &input) {
2525 T val;
2526 bool converted = detail::lexical_cast(input, val);
2527 if((!converted) || (val < min || val > max))
2528 return std::string("Value ") + input + " not in range " + std::to_string(min) + " to " +
2529 std::to_string(max);
2530
2531 return std::string();
2532 };
2533 }
2534
2536 template <typename T> explicit Range(T max) : Range(static_cast<T>(0), max) {}
2537};
2538
2540class Bound : public Validator {
2541 public:
2546 template <typename T> Bound(T min, T max) {
2547 std::stringstream out;
2548 out << detail::type_name<T>() << " bounded to [" << min << " - " << max << "]";
2549 description(out.str());
2550
2551 func_ = [min, max](std::string &input) {
2552 T val;
2553 bool converted = detail::lexical_cast(input, val);
2554 if(!converted) {
2555 return std::string("Value ") + input + " could not be converted";
2556 }
2557 if(val < min)
2558 input = detail::to_string(min);
2559 else if(val > max)
2560 input = detail::to_string(max);
2561
2562 return std::string{};
2563 };
2564 }
2565
2567 template <typename T> explicit Bound(T max) : Bound(static_cast<T>(0), max) {}
2568};
2569
2570namespace detail {
2571template <typename T,
2572 enable_if_t<is_copyable_ptr<typename std::remove_reference<T>::type>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2573auto smart_deref(T value) -> decltype(*value) {
2574 return *value;
2575}
2576
2577template <
2578 typename T,
2579 enable_if_t<!is_copyable_ptr<typename std::remove_reference<T>::type>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2580typename std::remove_reference<T>::type &smart_deref(T &value) {
2581 return value;
2582}
2584template <typename T> std::string generate_set(const T &set) {
2585 using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type;
2586 using iteration_type_t = typename detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::value_type; // the type of the object pair
2587 std::string out(1, '{');
2588 out.append(detail::join(
2589 detail::smart_deref(set),
2590 [](const iteration_type_t &v) { return detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first(v); },
2591 ","));
2592 out.push_back('}');
2593 return out;
2594}
2595
2597template <typename T> std::string generate_map(const T &map, bool key_only = false) {
2598 using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type;
2599 using iteration_type_t = typename detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::value_type; // the type of the object pair
2600 std::string out(1, '{');
2601 out.append(detail::join(
2602 detail::smart_deref(map),
2603 [key_only](const iteration_type_t &v) {
2604 std::string res{detail::to_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first(v))};
2605
2606 if(!key_only) {
2607 res.append("->");
2608 res += detail::to_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::second(v));
2609 }
2610 return res;
2611 },
2612 ","));
2613 out.push_back('}');
2614 return out;
2615}
2616
2617template <typename C, typename V> struct has_find {
2618 template <typename CC, typename VV>
2619 static auto test(int) -> decltype(std::declval<CC>().find(std::declval<VV>()), std::true_type());
2620 template <typename, typename> static auto test(...) -> decltype(std::false_type());
2621
2622 static const auto value = decltype(test<C, V>(0))::value;
2623 using type = std::integral_constant<bool, value>;
2624};
2625
2627template <typename T, typename V, enable_if_t<!has_find<T, V>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2628auto search(const T &set, const V &val) -> std::pair<bool, decltype(std::begin(detail::smart_deref(set)))> {
2629 using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type;
2630 auto &setref = detail::smart_deref(set);
2631 auto it = std::find_if(std::begin(setref), std::end(setref), [&val](decltype(*std::begin(setref)) v) {
2632 return (detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first(v) == val);
2633 });
