2634 return {(it != std::end(setref)), it};
2635}
2636
2638template <typename T, typename V, enable_if_t<has_find<T, V>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2639auto search(const T &set, const V &val) -> std::pair<bool, decltype(std::begin(detail::smart_deref(set)))> {
2640 auto &setref = detail::smart_deref(set);
2641 auto it = setref.find(val);
2642 return {(it != std::end(setref)), it};
2643}
2644
2646template <typename T, typename V>
2647auto search(const T &set, const V &val, const std::function<V(V)> &filter_function)
2648 -> std::pair<bool, decltype(std::begin(detail::smart_deref(set)))> {
2649 using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type;
2650 // do the potentially faster first search
2651 auto res = search(set, val);
2652 if((res.first) || (!(filter_function))) {
2653 return res;
2654 }
2655 // if we haven't found it do the longer linear search with all the element translations
2656 auto &setref = detail::smart_deref(set);
2657 auto it = std::find_if(std::begin(setref), std::end(setref), [&](decltype(*std::begin(setref)) v) {
2658 V a{detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first(v)};
2659 a = filter_function(a);
2660 return (a == val);
2661 });
2662 return {(it != std::end(setref)), it};
2663}
2664
2665// the following suggestion was made by Nikita Ofitserov(@himikof)
2666// done in templates to prevent compiler warnings on negation of unsigned numbers
2667
2669template <typename T>
2670inline typename std::enable_if<std::is_signed<T>::value, T>::type overflowCheck(const T &a, const T &b) {
2671 if((a > 0) == (b > 0)) {
2672 return ((std::numeric_limits<T>::max)() / (std::abs)(a) < (std::abs)(b));
2673 } else {
2674 return ((std::numeric_limits<T>::min)() / (std::abs)(a) > -(std::abs)(b));
2675 }
2676}
2678template <typename T>
2679inline typename std::enable_if<!std::is_signed<T>::value, T>::type overflowCheck(const T &a, const T &b) {
2680 return ((std::numeric_limits<T>::max)() / a < b);
2681}
2682
2684template <typename T> typename std::enable_if<std::is_integral<T>::value, bool>::type checked_multiply(T &a, T b) {
2685 if(a == 0 || b == 0 || a == 1 || b == 1) {
2686 a *= b;
2687 return true;
2688 }
2689 if(a == (std::numeric_limits<T>::min)() || b == (std::numeric_limits<T>::min)()) {
2690 return false;
2691 }
2692 if(overflowCheck(a, b)) {
2693 return false;
2694 }
2695 a *= b;
2696 return true;
2697}
2698
2700template <typename T>
2701typename std::enable_if<std::is_floating_point<T>::value, bool>::type checked_multiply(T &a, T b) {
2702 T c = a * b;
2703 if(std::isinf(c) && !std::isinf(a) && !std::isinf(b)) {
2704 return false;
2705 }
2706 a = c;
2707 return true;
2708}
2709
2710} // namespace detail
2712class IsMember : public Validator {
2713 public:
2714 using filter_fn_t = std::function<std::string(std::string)>;
2715
2717 template <typename T, typename... Args>
2718 IsMember(std::initializer_list<T> values, Args &&... args)
2719 : IsMember(std::vector<T>(values), std::forward<Args>(args)...) {}
2720
2722 template <typename T> explicit IsMember(T &&set) : IsMember(std::forward<T>(set), nullptr) {}
2723
2726 template <typename T, typename F> explicit IsMember(T set, F filter_function) {
2727
2728 // Get the type of the contained item - requires a container have ::value_type
2729 // if the type does not have first_type and second_type, these are both value_type
2730 using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type; // Removes (smart) pointers if needed
2731 using item_t = typename detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first_type; // Is value_type if not a map
2732
2733 using local_item_t = typename IsMemberType<item_t>::type; // This will convert bad types to good ones
2734 // (const char * to std::string)
2735
2736 // Make a local copy of the filter function, using a std::function if not one already
2737 std::function<local_item_t(local_item_t)> filter_fn = filter_function;
2738
2739 // This is the type name for help, it will take the current version of the set contents
2740 desc_function_ = [set]() { return detail::generate_set(detail::smart_deref(set)); };
2741
2742 // This is the function that validates
2743 // It stores a copy of the set pointer-like, so shared_ptr will stay alive
2744 func_ = [set, filter_fn](std::string &input) {
2745 local_item_t b;
2746 if(!detail::lexical_cast(input, b)) {
2747 throw ValidationError(input); // name is added later
2748 }
2749 if(filter_fn) {
2750 b = filter_fn(b);
2751 }
2752 auto res = detail::search(set, b, filter_fn);
2753 if(res.first) {
2754 // Make sure the version in the input string is identical to the one in the set
2755 if(filter_fn) {
2756 input = detail::value_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first(*(res.second)));
2757 }
2758
2759 // Return empty error string (success)
2760 return std::string{};
2761 }
2762
2763 // If you reach this point, the result was not found
2764 std::string out(" not in ");
2765 out += detail::generate_set(detail::smart_deref(set));
2766 return out;
2767 };
2768 }
2769
2771 template <typename T, typename... Args>
2772 IsMember(T &&set, filter_fn_t filter_fn_1, filter_fn_t filter_fn_2, Args &&... other)
2773 : IsMember(
2774 std::forward<T>(set),
2775 [filter_fn_1, filter_fn_2](std::string a) { return filter_fn_2(filter_fn_1(a)); },
2776 other...) {}
2777};
2778
2780template <typename T> using TransformPairs = std::vector<std::pair<std::string, T>>;
2781
2783class Transformer : public Validator {
2784 public:
2785 using filter_fn_t = std::function<std::string(std::string)>;
2786
2788 template <typename... Args>
2789 Transformer(std::initializer_list<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> values, Args &&... args)
2790 : Transformer(TransformPairs<std::string>(values), std::forward<Args>(args)...) {}
2791
2793 template <typename T> explicit Transformer(T &&mapping) : Transformer(std::forward<T>(mapping), nullptr) {}
2794
2797 template <typename T, typename F> explicit Transformer(T mapping, F filter_function) {
2798
2799 static_assert(detail::pair_adaptor<typename detail::element_type<T>::type>::value,
2800 "mapping must produce value pairs");
2801 // Get the type of the contained item - requires a container have ::value_type
2802 // if the type does not have first_type and second_type, these are both value_type
2803 using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type; // Removes (smart) pointers if needed
2804 using item_t = typename detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first_type; // Is value_type if not a map
2805 using local_item_t = typename IsMemberType<item_t>::type; // This will convert bad types to good ones
2806 // (const char * to std::string)
2807
2808 // Make a local copy of the filter function, using a std::function if not one already
2809 std::function<local_item_t(local_item_t)> filter_fn = filter_function;
2810
2811 // This is the type name for help, it will take the current version of the set contents
2812 desc_function_ = [mapping]() { return detail::generate_map(detail::smart_deref(mapping)); };
2813
2814 func_ = [mapping, filter_fn](std::string &input) {
2815 local_item_t b;
2816 if(!detail::lexical_cast(input, b)) {
2817 return std::string();
2818 // there is no possible way we can match anything in the mapping if we can't convert so just return
2819 }
2820 if(filter_fn) {
2821 b = filter_fn(b);
2822 }
2823 auto res = detail::search(mapping, b, filter_fn);
2824 if(res.first) {
2825 input = detail::value_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::second(*res.second));
2826 }
2827 return std::string{};
2828 };
2829 }
2830
2832 template <typename T, typename... Args>
2833 Transformer(T &&mapping, filter_fn_t filter_fn_1, filter_fn_t filter_fn_2, Args &&... other)
2834 : Transformer(
2835 std::forward<T>(mapping),
2836 [filter_fn_1, filter_fn_2](std::string a) { return filter_fn_2(filter_fn_1(a)); },
2837 other...) {}
2838};
2839
2841class CheckedTransformer : public Validator {
2842 public:
2843 using filter_fn_t = std::function<std::string(std::string)>;
2844
2846 template <typename... Args>
2847 CheckedTransformer(std::initializer_list<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> values, Args &&... args)
2848 : CheckedTransformer(TransformPairs<std::string>(values), std::forward<Args>(args)...) {}
2849
2851 template <typename T> explicit CheckedTransformer(T mapping) : CheckedTransformer(std::move(mapping), nullptr) {}
2852
2855 template <typename T, typename F> explicit CheckedTransformer(T mapping, F filter_function) {
2856
2857 static_assert(detail::pair_adaptor<typename detail::element_type<T>::type>::value,
2858 "mapping must produce value pairs");
2859 // Get the type of the contained item - requires a container have ::value_type
2860 // if the type does not have first_type and second_type, these are both value_type
2861 using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type; // Removes (smart) pointers if needed
2862 using item_t = typename detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first_type; // Is value_type if not a map
2863 using local_item_t = typename IsMemberType<item_t>::type; // This will convert bad types to good ones
2864 // (const char * to std::string)
2865 using iteration_type_t = typename detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::value_type; // the type of the object pair //
2866 // the type of the object pair
2867
2868 // Make a local copy of the filter function, using a std::function if not one already
2869 std::function<local_item_t(local_item_t)> filter_fn = filter_function;
2870
2871 auto tfunc = [mapping]() {
2872 std::string out("value in ");
2873 out += detail::generate_map(detail::smart_deref(mapping)) + " OR {";
2874 out += detail::join(
2875 detail::smart_deref(mapping),
2876 [](const iteration_type_t &v) { return detail::to_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::second(v)); },
2877 ",");
2878 out.push_back('}');
2879 return out;
2880 };
2881
2882 desc_function_ = tfunc;
2883
2884 func_ = [mapping, tfunc, filter_fn](std::string &input) {
2885 local_item_t b;
2886 bool converted = detail::lexical_cast(input, b);
2887 if(converted) {
2888 if(filter_fn) {
2889 b = filter_fn(b);
2890 }
2891 auto res = detail::search(mapping, b, filter_fn);
2892 if(res.first) {
2893 input = detail::value_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::second(*res.second));
2894 return std::string{};
2895 }
2896 }
2897 for(const auto &v : detail::smart_deref(mapping)) {
2898 auto output_string = detail::value_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::second(v));
2899 if(output_string == input) {
2900 return std::string();
2901 }
2902 }
2903
2904 return "Check " + input + " " + tfunc() + " FAILED";
2905 };
2906 }
2907
2909 template <typename T, typename... Args>
2910 CheckedTransformer(T &&mapping, filter_fn_t filter_fn_1, filter_fn_t filter_fn_2, Args &&... other)
2911 : CheckedTransformer(
2912 std::forward<T>(mapping),
2913 [filter_fn_1, filter_fn_2](std::string a) { return filter_fn_2(filter_fn_1(a)); },
2914 other...) {}
2915};
2916
2918inline std::string ignore_case(std::string item) { return detail::to_lower(item); }
2919
2921inline std::string ignore_underscore(std::string item) { return detail::remove_underscore(item); }
2922
2924inline std::string ignore_space(std::string item) {
2925 item.erase(std::remove(std::begin(item), std::end(item), ' '), std::end(item));
2926 item.erase(std::remove(std::begin(item), std::end(item), '\t'), std::end(item));
2927 return item;
2928}
2929
2941class AsNumberWithUnit : public Validator {
2942 public:
2947 enum Options {
2948 CASE_SENSITIVE = 0,
2949 CASE_INSENSITIVE = 1,
2950 UNIT_OPTIONAL = 0,
2951 UNIT_REQUIRED = 2,
2952 DEFAULT = CASE_INSENSITIVE | UNIT_OPTIONAL
2953 };
2954
2955 template <typename Number>
2956 explicit AsNumberWithUnit(std::map<std::string, Number> mapping,
2957 Options opts = DEFAULT,
2958 const std::string &unit_name = "UNIT") {
2959 description(generate_description<Number>(unit_name, opts));
2960 validate_mapping(mapping, opts);
2961
2962 // transform function
2963 func_ = [mapping, opts](std::string &input) -> std::string {
2964 Number num;
2965
2966 detail::rtrim(input);
2967 if(input.empty()) {
2968 throw ValidationError("Input is empty");
2969 }
2970
2971 // Find split position between number and prefix
2972 auto unit_begin = input.end();
2973 while(unit_begin > input.begin() && std::isalpha(*(unit_begin - 1), std::locale())) {
2974 --unit_begin;
2975 }
2976
2977 std::string unit{unit_begin, input.end()};
2978 input.resize(static_cast<std::size_t>(std::distance(input.begin(), unit_begin)));
2979 detail::trim(input);
2980
2981 if(opts & UNIT_REQUIRED && unit.empty()) {
2982 throw ValidationError("Missing mandatory unit");
2983 }
2984 if(opts & CASE_INSENSITIVE) {
2985 unit = detail::to_lower(unit);
2986 }
2987
2988 bool converted = detail::lexical_cast(input, num);
2989 if(!converted) {
2990 throw ValidationError(std::string("Value ") + input + " could not be converted to " +
2991 detail::type_name<Number>());
2992 }
2993
2994 if(unit.empty()) {
2995 // No need to modify input if no unit passed
2996 return {};
2997 }
2998
2999 // find corresponding factor
3000 auto it = mapping.find(unit);
3001 if(it == mapping.end()) {
3002 throw ValidationError(unit +
3003 " unit not recognized. "
3004 "Allowed values: " +
3005 detail::generate_map(mapping, true));
3006 }
3007
3008 // perform safe multiplication
3009 bool ok = detail::checked_multiply(num, it->second);
3010 if(!ok) {
3011 throw ValidationError(detail::to_string(num) + " multiplied by " + unit +
3012 " factor would cause number overflow. Use smaller value.");
3013 }
3014 input = detail::to_string(num);
3015
3016 return {};
3017 };
3018 }
3019
3020 private:
3023 template <typename Number> static void validate_mapping(std::map<std::string, Number> &mapping, Options opts) {
3024 for(auto &kv : mapping) {
3025 if(kv.first.empty()) {
3026 throw ValidationError("Unit must not be empty.");
3027 }
3028 if(!detail::isalpha(kv.first)) {
3029 throw ValidationError("Unit must contain only letters.");
3030 }
3031 }
3032
3033 // make all units lowercase if CASE_INSENSITIVE
3034 if(opts & CASE_INSENSITIVE) {
3035 std::map<std::string, Number> lower_mapping;
3036 for(auto &kv : mapping) {
3037 auto s = detail::to_lower(kv.first);
3038 if(lower_mapping.count(s)) {
3039 throw ValidationError(std::string("Several matching lowercase unit representations are found: ") +
3040 s);
3041 }
3042 lower_mapping[detail::to_lower(kv.first)] = kv.second;
3043 }
3044 mapping = std::move(lower_mapping);
3045 }
3046 }
3047
3049 template <typename Number> static std::string generate_description(const std::string &name, Options opts) {
3050 std::stringstream out;
3051 out << detail::type_name<Number>() << ' ';
3052 if(opts & UNIT_REQUIRED) {
3053 out << name;
3054 } else {
3055 out << '[' << name << ']';
3056 }
3057 return out.str();
3058 }
3059};
3060
3072class AsSizeValue : public AsNumberWithUnit {
3073 public:
3074 using result_t = uint64_t;
3075
3083 explicit AsSizeValue(bool kb_is_1000) : AsNumberWithUnit(get_mapping(kb_is_1000)) {
3084 if(kb_is_1000) {
3085 description("SIZE [b, kb(=1000b), kib(=1024b), ...]");
3086 } else {
3087 description("SIZE [b, kb(=1024b), ...]");
3088 }
3089 }
3090
3091 private:
3093 static std::map<std::string, result_t> init_mapping(bool kb_is_1000) {
3094 std::map<std::string, result_t> m;
3095 result_t k_factor = kb_is_1000 ? 1000 : 1024;
3096 result_t ki_factor = 1024;
3097 result_t k = 1;
3098 result_t ki = 1;
3099 m["b"] = 1;
3100 for(std::string p : {"k", "m", "g", "t", "p", "e"}) {
3101 k *= k_factor;
3102 ki *= ki_factor;
3103 m[p] = k;
3104 m[p + "b"] = k;
3105 m[p + "i"] = ki;
3106 m[p + "ib"] = ki;
3107 }
3108 return m;
3109 }
3110
3112 static std::map<std::string, result_t> get_mapping(bool kb_is_1000) {
3113 if(kb_is_1000) {
3114 static auto m = init_mapping(true);
3115 return m;
3116 } else {
3117 static auto m = init_mapping(false);
3118 return m;
3119 }
3120 }
3121};
3122
3123namespace detail {
3128inline std::pair<std::string, std::string> split_program_name(std::string commandline) {
3129 // try to determine the programName
3130 std::pair<std::string, std::string> vals;
3131 trim(commandline);
3132 auto esp = commandline.find_first_of(' ', 1);
3133 while(detail::check_path(commandline.substr(0, esp).c_str()) != path_type::file) {
3134 esp = commandline.find_first_of(' ', esp + 1);
3135 if(esp == std::string::npos) {
3136 // if we have reached the end and haven't found a valid file just assume the first argument is the
3137 // program name
3138 esp = commandline.find_first_of(' ', 1);
3139 break;
3140 }
3141 }
3142 vals.first = commandline.substr(0, esp);
3143 rtrim(vals.first);
3144 // strip the program name
3145 vals.second = (esp != std::string::npos) ? commandline.substr(esp + 1) : std::string{};
3146 ltrim(vals.second);
3147 return vals;
3148}
3149
3150} // namespace detail
3152
3153} // namespace CLI
3154
3155// From CLI/FormatterFwd.hpp:
3156
3157namespace CLI {
3158
3159class Option;
3160class App;
3161
3166
3167enum class AppFormatMode {
3168 Normal, //< The normal, detailed help
3169 All, //< A fully expanded help
3170 Sub, //< Used when printed as part of expanded subcommand
3171};
3172
3177class FormatterBase {
3178 protected:
3181
3183 std::size_t column_width_{30};
3184
3187 std::map<std::string, std::string> labels_{};
3188
3192
3193 public:
3194 FormatterBase() = default;
3195 FormatterBase(const FormatterBase &) = default;
3196 FormatterBase(FormatterBase &&) = default;
3197
3199 virtual ~FormatterBase() noexcept {} // NOLINT(modernize-use-equals-default)
3200
3202 virtual std::string make_help(const App *, std::string, AppFormatMode) const = 0;
3203
3207
3209 void label(std::string key, std::string val) { labels_[key] = val; }
3210
3212 void column_width(std::size_t val) { column_width_ = val; }
3213
3217
3219 std::string get_label(std::string key) const {
3220 if(labels_.find(key) == labels_.end())
3221 return key;
3222 else
3223 return labels_.at(key);
3224 }
3225
3227 std::size_t get_column_width() const { return column_width_; }
3228
3230};
3231
3233class FormatterLambda final : public FormatterBase {
3234 using funct_t = std::function<std::string(const App *, std::string, AppFormatMode)>;
3235
3237 funct_t lambda_;
3238
3239 public:
3241 explicit FormatterLambda(funct_t funct) : lambda_(std::move(funct)) {}
3242
3244 ~FormatterLambda() noexcept override {} // NOLINT(modernize-use-equals-default)
3245
3247 std::string make_help(const App *app, std::string name, AppFormatMode mode) const override {
3248 return lambda_(app, name, mode);
3249 }
3250};
3251
3254class Formatter : public FormatterBase {
3255 public:
3256 Formatter() = default;
3257 Formatter(const Formatter &) = default;
3258 Formatter(Formatter &&) = default;
3259
3262
3265 virtual std::string make_group(std::string group, bool is_positional, std::vector<const Option *> opts) const;
3266
3268 virtual std::string make_positionals(const App *app) const;
3269
3271 std::string make_groups(const App *app, AppFormatMode mode) const;
3272
3274 virtual std::string make_subcommands(const App *app, AppFormatMode mode) const;
3275
3277 virtual std::string make_subcommand(const App *sub) const;
3278
3280 virtual std::string make_expanded(const App *sub) const;
3281
3283 virtual std::string make_footer(const App *app) const;
3284
3286 virtual std::string make_description(const App *app) const;
3287
3289 virtual std::string make_usage(const App *app, std::string name) const;
3290
3292 std::string make_help(const App * /*app*/, std::string, AppFormatMode) const override;
3293
3297
3299 virtual std::string make_option(const Option *opt, bool is_positional) const {
3300 std::stringstream out;
3301 detail::format_help(
3302 out, make_option_name(opt, is_positional) + make_option_opts(opt), make_option_desc(opt), column_width_);
3303 return out.str();
3304 }
3305
3307 virtual std::string make_option_name(const Option *, bool) const;
3308
3310 virtual std::string make_option_opts(const Option *) const;
3311
3313 virtual std::string make_option_desc(const Option *) const;
3314
3316 virtual std::string make_option_usage(const Option *opt) const;
3317
3319};
3320
3321} // namespace CLI
3322
3323// From CLI/Option.hpp:
3324
3325namespace CLI {
3326
3327using results_t = std::vector<std::string>;
3329using callback_t = std::function<bool(const results_t &)>;
3330
3331class Option;
3332class App;
3333
3334using Option_p = std::unique_ptr<Option>;
3336enum class MultiOptionPolicy : char {
3337 Throw,
3338 TakeLast,
3339 TakeFirst,
3340 Join,
3341 TakeAll
3342};
3343
3346template <typename CRTP> class OptionBase {
3347 friend App;
3348
3349 protected:
3351 std::string group_ = std::string("Options");
3352
3354 bool required_{false};
3355
3357 bool ignore_case_{false};
3358
3360 bool ignore_underscore_{false};
3361
3363 bool configurable_{true};
3364
3366 bool disable_flag_override_{false};
3367
3369 char delimiter_{'\0'};
3370
3372 bool always_capture_default_{false};
3373
3375 MultiOptionPolicy multi_option_policy_{MultiOptionPolicy::Throw};
3376
3378 template <typename T> void copy_to(T *other) const {
3379 other->group(group_);
3380 other->required(required_);
3381 other->ignore_case(ignore_case_);
3382 other->ignore_underscore(ignore_underscore_);
3383 other->configurable(configurable_);
3384 other->disable_flag_override(disable_flag_override_);
3385 other->delimiter(delimiter_);
3386 other->always_capture_default(always_capture_default_);
3387 other->multi_option_policy(multi_option_policy_);
3388 }
3389
3390 public:
3391 // setters
3392
3394 CRTP *group(const std::string &name) {
3395 group_ = name;
3396 return static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
3397 }
3398
3400 CRTP *required(bool value = true) {
3401 required_ = value;
3402 return static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
3403 }
3404
3406 CRTP *mandatory(bool value = true) { return required(value); }
3407
3408 CRTP *always_capture_default(bool value = true) {
3409 always_capture_default_ = value;
3410 return static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
3411 }
3412
3413 // Getters
3414
3416 const std::string &get_group() const { return group_; }
3417
3419 bool get_required() const { return required_; }
3420
3422 bool get_ignore_case() const { return ignore_case_; }
3423
3425 bool get_ignore_underscore() const { return ignore_underscore_; }
3426
3428 bool get_configurable() const { return configurable_; }
3429
3431 bool get_disable_flag_override() const { return disable_flag_override_; }
3432
3434 char get_delimiter() const { return delimiter_; }
3435
3437 bool get_always_capture_default() const { return always_capture_default_; }
3438
3440 MultiOptionPolicy get_multi_option_policy() const { return multi_option_policy_; }
3441
3442 // Shortcuts for multi option policy
3443
3445 CRTP *take_last() {
3446 auto self = static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
3447 self->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeLast);
3448 return self;
3449 }
3450
3452 CRTP *take_first() {
3453 auto self = static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
3454 self->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeFirst);
3455 return self;
3456 }
3457
3459 CRTP *take_all() {
3460 auto self = static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
3461 self->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeAll);
3462 return self;
3463 }
3464
3466 CRTP *join() {
3467 auto self = static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
3468 self->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::Join);
3469 return self;
3470 }
3471
3473 CRTP *join(char delim) {
3474 auto self = static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
3475 self->delimiter_ = delim;
3476 self->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::Join);
3477 return self;
3478 }
3479
3481 CRTP *configurable(bool value = true) {
3482 configurable_ = value;
3483 return static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
3484 }
3485
3487 CRTP *delimiter(char value = '\0') {
3488 delimiter_ = value;
3489 return static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
3490 }
3491};
3492
3495class OptionDefaults : public OptionBase<OptionDefaults> {
3496 public:
3497 OptionDefaults() = default;
3498
3499 // Methods here need a different implementation if they are Option vs. OptionDefault
3500
3502 OptionDefaults *multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy value = MultiOptionPolicy::Throw) {
3503 multi_option_policy_ = value;
3504 return this;
3505 }
3506
3508 OptionDefaults *ignore_case(bool value = true) {
3509 ignore_case_ = value;
3510 return this;
3511 }
3512
3514 OptionDefaults *ignore_underscore(bool value = true) {
3515 ignore_underscore_ = value;
3516 return this;
3517 }
3518
3520 OptionDefaults *disable_flag_override(bool value = true) {
3521 disable_flag_override_ = value;
3522 return this;
3523 }
3524
3526 OptionDefaults *delimiter(char value = '\0') {
3527 delimiter_ = value;
3528 return this;
3529 }
3530};
3531
3532class Option : public OptionBase<Option> {
3533 friend App;
3534
3535 protected:
3538
3540 std::vector<std::string> snames_{};
3541
3543 std::vector<std::string> lnames_{};
3544
3547 std::vector<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> default_flag_values_{};
3548
3550 std::vector<std::string> fnames_{};
3551
3553 std::string pname_{};
3554
3556 std::string envname_{};
3557
3561
3563 std::string description_{};
3564
3566 std::string default_str_{};
3567
3571 std::function<std::string()> type_name_{[]() { return std::string(); }};
3572
3574 std::function<std::string()> default_function_{};
3575
3579
3582 int type_size_max_{1};
3584 int type_size_min_{1};
3585
3587 int expected_min_{1};
3589 int expected_max_{1};
3590
3592 std::vector<Validator> validators_{};
3593
3595 std::set<Option *> needs_{};
3596
3598 std::set<Option *> excludes_{};
3599
3603
3605 App *parent_{nullptr};
3606
3608 callback_t callback_{};
3609
3613
3615 results_t results_{};
3617 results_t proc_results_{};
3619 enum class option_state {
3620 parsing = 0,
3621 validated = 2,
3622 reduced = 4,
3623 callback_run = 6,
3624 };
3626 option_state current_option_state_{option_state::parsing};
3628 bool allow_extra_args_{false};
3630 bool flag_like_{false};
3632 bool run_callback_for_default_{false};
3634
3636 Option(std::string option_name, std::string option_description, callback_t callback, App *parent)
3637 : description_(std::move(option_description)), parent_(parent), callback_(std::move(callback)) {
3638 std::tie(snames_, lnames_, pname_) = detail::get_names(detail::split_names(option_name));
3639 }
3640
3641 public:
3644
3645 Option(const Option &) = delete;
3646 Option &operator=(const Option &) = delete;
3647
3649 std::size_t count() const { return results_.size(); }
3650
3652 bool empty() const { return results_.empty(); }
3653
3655 explicit operator bool() const { return !empty(); }
3656
3658 void clear() {
3659 results_.clear();
3660 current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
3661 }
3662
3666
3668 Option *expected(int value) {
3669 if(value < 0) {
3670 expected_min_ = -value;
3671 if(expected_max_ < expected_min_) {
3672 expected_max_ = expected_min_;
3673 }
3674 allow_extra_args_ = true;
3675 flag_like_ = false;
3676 } else if(value == detail::expected_max_vector_size) {
3677 expected_min_ = 1;
3678 expected_max_ = detail::expected_max_vector_size;
3679 allow_extra_args_ = true;
3680 flag_like_ = false;
3681 } else {
3682 expected_min_ = value;
3683 expected_max_ = value;
3684 flag_like_ = (expected_min_ == 0);
3685 }
3686 return this;
3687 }
3688
3690 Option *expected(int value_min, int value_max) {
3691 if(value_min < 0) {
3692 value_min = -value_min;
3693 }
3694
3695 if(value_max < 0) {
3696 value_max = detail::expected_max_vector_size;
3697 }
3698 if(value_max < value_min) {
3699 expected_min_ = value_max;
3700 expected_max_ = value_min;
3701 } else {
3702 expected_max_ = value_max;
3703 expected_min_ = value_min;
3704 }
3705
3706 return this;
3707 }
3710 Option *allow_extra_args(bool value = true) {
3711 allow_extra_args_ = value;
3712 return this;
3713 }
3715 bool get_allow_extra_args() const { return allow_extra_args_; }
3716
3719 Option *run_callback_for_default(bool value = true) {
3720 run_callback_for_default_ = value;
3721 return this;
3722 }
3724 bool get_run_callback_for_default() const { return run_callback_for_default_; }
3725
3727 Option *check(Validator validator, const std::string &validator_name = "") {
3728 validator.non_modifying();
3729 validators_.push_back(std::move(validator));
3730 if(!validator_name.empty())
3731 validators_.back().name(validator_name);
3732 return this;
3733 }
3734
3736 Option *check(std::function<std::string(const std::string &)> Validator,
3737 std::string Validator_description = "",
3738 std::string Validator_name = "") {
3739 validators_.emplace_back(Validator, std::move(Validator_description), std::move(Validator_name));
3740 validators_.back().non_modifying();
3741 return this;
3742 }
3743
3745 Option *transform(Validator Validator, const std::string &Validator_name = "") {
3746 validators_.insert(validators_.begin(), std::move(Validator));
3747 if(!Validator_name.empty())
3748 validators_.front().name(Validator_name);
3749 return this;
3750 }
3751
3753 Option *transform(const std::function<std::string(std::string)> &func,
3754 std::string transform_description = "",
3755 std::string transform_name = "") {
3756 validators_.insert(validators_.begin(),
3757 Validator(
3758 [func](std::string &val) {
3759 val = func(val);
3760 return std::string{};
3761 },
3762 std::move(transform_description),
3763 std::move(transform_name)));
3764
3765 return this;
3766 }
3767
3769 Option *each(const std::function<void(std::string)> &func) {
3770 validators_.emplace_back(
3771 [func](std::string &inout) {
3772 func(inout);
3773 return std::string{};
3774 },
3775 std::string{});
3776 return this;
3777 }
3779 Validator *get_validator(const std::string &Validator_name = "") {
3780 for(auto &Validator : validators_) {
3781 if(Validator_name == Validator.get_name()) {
3782 return &Validator;
3783 }
3784 }
3785 if((Validator_name.empty()) && (!validators_.empty())) {
3786 return &(validators_.front());
3787 }
3788 throw OptionNotFound(std::string{"Validator "} + Validator_name + " Not Found");
3789 }
3790
3792 Validator *get_validator(int index) {
3793 // This is an signed int so that it is not equivalent to a pointer.
3794 if(index >= 0 && index < static_cast<int>(validators_.size())) {
3795 return &(validators_[static_cast<decltype(validators_)::size_type>(index)]);
3796 }
3797 throw OptionNotFound("Validator index is not valid");
3798 }
3799
3801 Option *needs(Option *opt) {
3802 if(opt != this) {
3803 needs_.insert(opt);
3804 }
3805 return this;
3806 }
3807
3809 template <typename T = App> Option *needs(std::string opt_name) {
3810 auto opt = dynamic_cast<T *>(parent_)->get_option_no_throw(opt_name);
3811 if(opt == nullptr) {
3812 throw IncorrectConstruction::MissingOption(opt_name);
3813 }
3814 return needs(opt);
3815 }
3816
3818 template <typename A, typename B, typename... ARG> Option *needs(A opt, B opt1, ARG... args) {
3819 needs(opt);
3820 return needs(opt1, args...);
3821 }
3822
3824 bool remove_needs(Option *opt) {
3825 auto iterator = std::find(std::begin(needs_), std::end(needs_), opt);
3826
3827 if(iterator == std::end(needs_)) {
3828 return false;
3829 }
3830 needs_.erase(iterator);
3831 return true;
3832 }
3833
3835 Option *excludes(Option *opt) {
3836 if(opt == this) {
3837 throw(IncorrectConstruction("and option cannot exclude itself"));
3838 }
3839 excludes_.insert(opt);
3840
3841 // Help text should be symmetric - excluding a should exclude b
3842 opt->excludes_.insert(this);
3843
3844 // Ignoring the insert return value, excluding twice is now allowed.
3845 // (Mostly to allow both directions to be excluded by user, even though the library does it for you.)
3846
3847 return this;
3848 }
3849
3851 template <typename T = App> Option *excludes(std::string opt_name) {
3852 auto opt = dynamic_cast<T *>(parent_)->get_option_no_throw(opt_name);
3853 if(opt == nullptr) {
3854 throw IncorrectConstruction::MissingOption(opt_name);
3855 }
3856 return excludes(opt);
3857 }
3858
3860 template <typename A, typename B, typename... ARG> Option *excludes(A opt, B opt1, ARG... args) {
3861 excludes(opt);
3862 return excludes(opt1, args...);
3863 }
3864
3866 bool remove_excludes(Option *opt) {
3867 auto iterator = std::find(std::begin(excludes_), std::end(excludes_), opt);
3868
3869 if(iterator == std::end(excludes_)) {
3870 return false;
3871 }
3872 excludes_.erase(iterator);
3873 return true;
3874 }
3875
3877 Option *envname(std::string name) {
3878 envname_ = std::move(name);
3879 return this;
3880 }
3881
3886 template <typename T = App> Option *ignore_case(bool value = true) {
3887 if(!ignore_case_ && value) {
3888 ignore_case_ = value;
3889 auto *parent = dynamic_cast<T *>(parent_);
3890 for(const Option_p &opt : parent->options_) {
3891 if(opt.get() == this) {
3892 continue;
3893 }
3894 auto &omatch = opt->matching_name(*this);
3895 if(!omatch.empty()) {
3896 ignore_case_ = false;
3897 throw OptionAlreadyAdded("adding ignore case caused a name conflict with " + omatch);
3898 }
3899 }
3900 } else {
3901 ignore_case_ = value;
3902 }
3903 return this;
3904 }
3905
3910 template <typename T = App> Option *ignore_underscore(bool value = true) {
3911
3912 if(!ignore_underscore_ && value) {
3913 ignore_underscore_ = value;
3914 auto *parent = dynamic_cast<T *>(parent_);
3915 for(const Option_p &opt : parent->options_) {
3916 if(opt.get() == this) {
3917 continue;
3918 }
3919 auto &omatch = opt->matching_name(*this);
3920 if(!omatch.empty()) {
3921 ignore_underscore_ = false;
3922 throw OptionAlreadyAdded("adding ignore underscore caused a name conflict with " + omatch);
3923 }
3924 }
3925 } else {
3926 ignore_underscore_ = value;
3927 }
3928 return this;
3929 }
3930
3932 Option *multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy value = MultiOptionPolicy::Throw) {
3933 if(value != multi_option_policy_) {
3934 if(multi_option_policy_ == MultiOptionPolicy::Throw && expected_max_ == detail::expected_max_vector_size &&
3935 expected_min_ > 1) { // this bizarre condition is to maintain backwards compatibility
3936 // with the previous behavior of expected_ with vectors
3937 expected_max_ = expected_min_;
3938 }
3939 multi_option_policy_ = value;
3940 current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
3941 }
3942 return this;
3943 }
3944
3946 Option *disable_flag_override(bool value = true) {
3947 disable_flag_override_ = value;
3948 return this;
3949 }
3953
3955 int get_type_size() const { return type_size_min_; }
3956
3958 int get_type_size_min() const { return type_size_min_; }
3960 int get_type_size_max() const { return type_size_max_; }
3961
3963 std::string get_envname() const { return envname_; }
3964
3966 std::set<Option *> get_needs() const { return needs_; }
3967
3969 std::set<Option *> get_excludes() const { return excludes_; }
3970
3972 std::string get_default_str() const { return default_str_; }
3973
3975 callback_t get_callback() const { return callback_; }
3976
3978 const std::vector<std::string> &get_lnames() const { return lnames_; }
3979
3981 const std::vector<std::string> &get_snames() const { return snames_; }
3982
3984 const std::vector<std::string> &get_fnames() const { return fnames_; }
3985
3987 int get_expected() const { return expected_min_; }
3988
3990 int get_expected_min() const { return expected_min_; }
3992 int get_expected_max() const { return expected_max_; }
3993
3995 int get_items_expected_min() const { return type_size_min_ * expected_min_; }
3996
3998 int get_items_expected_max() const {
3999 int t = type_size_max_;
4000 return detail::checked_multiply(t, expected_max_) ? t : detail::expected_max_vector_size;
4001 }
4003 int get_items_expected() const { return get_items_expected_min(); }
4004
4006 bool get_positional() const { return pname_.length() > 0; }
4007
4009 bool nonpositional() const { return (snames_.size() + lnames_.size()) > 0; }
4010
4012 bool has_description() const { return description_.length() > 0; }
4013
4015 const std::string &get_description() const { return description_; }
4016
4018 Option *description(std::string option_description) {
4019 description_ = std::move(option_description);
4020 return this;
4021 }
4022
4026
4031 std::string get_name(bool positional = false, //<[input] Show the positional name
4032 bool all_options = false //<[input] Show every option
4033 ) const {
4034 if(get_group().empty())
4035 return {}; // Hidden
4036
4037 if(all_options) {
4038
4039 std::vector<std::string> name_list;
4040
4042 if((positional && (!pname_.empty())) || (snames_.empty() && lnames_.empty())) {
4043 name_list.push_back(pname_);
4044 }
4045 if((get_items_expected() == 0) && (!fnames_.empty())) {
4046 for(const std::string &sname : snames_) {
4047 name_list.push_back("-" + sname);
4048 if(check_fname(sname)) {
4049 name_list.back() += "{" + get_flag_value(sname, "") + "}";
4050 }
4051 }
4052
4053 for(const std::string &lname : lnames_) {
4054 name_list.push_back("--" + lname);
4055 if(check_fname(lname)) {
4056 name_list.back() += "{" + get_flag_value(lname, "") + "}";
4057 }
4058 }
4059 } else {
4060 for(const std::string &sname : snames_)
4061 name_list.push_back("-" + sname);
4062
4063 for(const std::string &lname : lnames_)
4064 name_list.push_back("--" + lname);
4065 }
4066
4067 return detail::join(name_list);
4068 }
4069
4070 // This returns the positional name no matter what
4071 if(positional)
4072 return pname_;
4073
4074 // Prefer long name
4075 if(!lnames_.empty())
4076 return std::string(2, '-') + lnames_[0];
4077
4078 // Or short name if no long name
4079 if(!snames_.empty())
4080 return std::string(1, '-') + snames_[0];
4081
4082 // If positional is the only name, it's okay to use that
4083 return pname_;
4084 }
4085
4089
4091 void run_callback() {
4092
4093 if(current_option_state_ == option_state::parsing) {
4094 _validate_results(results_);
4095 current_option_state_ = option_state::validated;
4096 }
4097
4098 if(current_option_state_ < option_state::reduced) {
4099 _reduce_results(proc_results_, results_);
4100 current_option_state_ = option_state::reduced;
4101 }
4102 if(current_option_state_ >= option_state::reduced) {
4103 current_option_state_ = option_state::callback_run;
4104 if(!(callback_)) {
4105 return;
4106 }
4107 const results_t &send_results = proc_results_.empty() ? results_ : proc_results_;
4108 bool local_result = callback_(send_results);
4109
4110 if(!local_result)
4111 throw ConversionError(get_name(), results_);
4112 }
4113 }
4114
4116 const std::string &matching_name(const Option &other) const {
4117 static const std::string estring;
4118 for(const std::string &sname : snames_)
4119 if(other.check_sname(sname))
4120 return sname;
4121 for(const std::string &lname : lnames_)
4122 if(other.check_lname(lname))
4123 return lname;
4124
4125 if(ignore_case_ ||
4126 ignore_underscore_) { // We need to do the inverse, in case we are ignore_case or ignore underscore
4127 for(const std::string &sname : other.snames_)
4128 if(check_sname(sname))
4129 return sname;
4130 for(const std::string &lname : other.lnames_)
4131 if(check_lname(lname))
4132 return lname;
4133 }
4134 return estring;
4135 }
4137 bool operator==(const Option &other) const { return !matching_name(other).empty(); }
4138
4140 bool check_name(std::string name) const {
4141
4142 if(name.length() > 2 && name[0] == '-' && name[1] == '-')
4143 return check_lname(name.substr(2));
4144 if(name.length() > 1 && name.front() == '-')
4145 return check_sname(name.substr(1));
4146
4147 std::string local_pname = pname_;
4148 if(ignore_underscore_) {
4149 local_pname = detail::remove_underscore(local_pname);
4150 name = detail::remove_underscore(name);
4151 }
4152 if(ignore_case_) {
4153 local_pname = detail::to_lower(local_pname);
4154 name = detail::to_lower(name);
4155 }
4156 return name == local_pname;
4157 }
4158
4160 bool check_sname(std::string name) const {
4161 return (detail::find_member(std::move(name), snames_, ignore_case_) >= 0);
4162 }
4163
4165 bool check_lname(std::string name) const {
4166 return (detail::find_member(std::move(name), lnames_, ignore_case_, ignore_underscore_) >= 0);
4167 }
4168
4170 bool check_fname(std::string name) const {
4171 if(fnames_.empty()) {
4172 return false;
4173 }
4174 return (detail::find_member(std::move(name), fnames_, ignore_case_, ignore_underscore_) >= 0);
4175 }
4176
4179 std::string get_flag_value(const std::string &name, std::string input_value) const {
4180 static const std::string trueString{"true"};
4181 static const std::string falseString{"false"};
4182 static const std::string emptyString{"{}"};
4183 // check for disable flag override_
4184 if(disable_flag_override_) {
4185 if(!((input_value.empty()) || (input_value == emptyString))) {
4186 auto default_ind = detail::find_member(name, fnames_, ignore_case_, ignore_underscore_);
4187 if(default_ind >= 0) {
4188 // We can static cast this to std::size_t because it is more than 0 in this block
4189 if(default_flag_values_[static_cast<std::size_t>(default_ind)].second != input_value) {
4190 throw(ArgumentMismatch::FlagOverride(name));
4191 }
4192 } else {
4193 if(input_value != trueString) {
4194 throw(ArgumentMismatch::FlagOverride(name));
4195 }
4196 }
4197 }
4198 }
4199 auto ind = detail::find_member(name, fnames_, ignore_case_, ignore_underscore_);
4200 if((input_value.empty()) || (input_value == emptyString)) {
4201 if(flag_like_) {
4202 return (ind < 0) ? trueString : default_flag_values_[static_cast<std::size_t>(ind)].second;
4203 } else {
4204 return (ind < 0) ? default_str_ : default_flag_values_[static_cast<std::size_t>(ind)].second;
4205 }
4206 }
4207 if(ind < 0) {
4208 return input_value;
4209 }
4210 if(default_flag_values_[static_cast<std::size_t>(ind)].second == falseString) {
4211 try {
4212 auto val = detail::to_flag_value(input_value);
4213 return (val == 1) ? falseString : (val == (-1) ? trueString : std::to_string(-val));
4214 } catch(const std::invalid_argument &) {
4215 return input_value;
4216 }
4217 } else {
4218 return input_value;
4219 }
4220 }
4221
4223 Option *add_result(std::string s) {
4224 _add_result(std::move(s), results_);
4225 current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
4226 return this;
4227 }
4228
4230 Option *add_result(std::string s, int &results_added) {
4231 results_added = _add_result(std::move(s), results_);
4232 current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
4233 return this;
4234 }
4235
4237 Option *add_result(std::vector<std::string> s) {
4238 for(auto &str : s) {
4239 _add_result(std::move(str), results_);
4240 }
4241 current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
4242 return this;
4243 }
4244
4246 results_t results() const { return results_; }
4247
4249 results_t reduced_results() const {
4250 results_t res = proc_results_.empty() ? results_ : proc_results_;
4251 if(current_option_state_ < option_state::reduced) {
4252 if(current_option_state_ == option_state::parsing) {
4253 res = results_;
4254 _validate_results(res);
4255 }
4256 if(!res.empty()) {
4257 results_t extra;
4258 _reduce_results(extra, res);
4259 if(!extra.empty()) {
4260 res = std::move(extra);
4261 }
4262 }
4263 }
4264 return res;
4265 }
4266
4268 template <typename T, enable_if_t<!std::is_const<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
4269 void results(T &output) const {
4270 bool retval;
4271 if(current_option_state_ >= option_state::reduced || (results_.size() == 1 && validators_.empty())) {
4272 const results_t &res = (proc_results_.empty()) ? results_ : proc_results_;
4273 retval = detail::lexical_conversion<T, T>(res, output);
4274 } else {
4275 results_t res;
4276 if(results_.empty()) {
4277 if(!default_str_.empty()) {
4278 //_add_results takes an rvalue only
4279 _add_result(std::string(default_str_), res);
4280 _validate_results(res);
4281 results_t extra;
4282 _reduce_results(extra, res);
4283 if(!extra.empty()) {
4284 res = std::move(extra);
4285 }
4286 } else {
4287 res.emplace_back();
4288 }
4289 } else {
4290 res = reduced_results();
4291 }
4292 retval = detail::lexical_conversion<T, T>(res, output);
4293 }
4294 if(!retval) {
4295 throw ConversionError(get_name(), results_);
4296 }
4297 }
4298
4300 template <typename T> T as() const {
4301 T output;
4302 results(output);
4303 return output;
4304 }
4305
4307 bool get_callback_run() const { return (current_option_state_ == option_state::callback_run); }
4308
4312
4314 Option *type_name_fn(std::function<std::string()> typefun) {
4315 type_name_ = std::move(typefun);
4316 return this;
4317 }
4318
4320 Option *type_name(std::string typeval) {
4321 type_name_fn([typeval]() { return typeval; });
4322 return this;
4323 }
4324
4326 Option *type_size(int option_type_size) {
4327 if(option_type_size < 0) {
4328 // this section is included for backwards compatibility
4329 type_size_max_ = -option_type_size;
4330 type_size_min_ = -option_type_size;
4331 expected_max_ = detail::expected_max_vector_size;
4332 } else {
4333 type_size_max_ = option_type_size;
4334 if(type_size_max_ < detail::expected_max_vector_size) {
4335 type_size_min_ = option_type_size;
4336 }
4337 if(type_size_max_ == 0)
4338 required_ = false;
4339 }
4340 return this;
4341 }
4343 Option *type_size(int option_type_size_min, int option_type_size_max) {
4344 if(option_type_size_min < 0 || option_type_size_max < 0) {
4345 // this section is included for backwards compatibility
4346 expected_max_ = detail::expected_max_vector_size;
4347 option_type_size_min = (std::abs)(option_type_size_min);
4348 option_type_size_max = (std::abs)(option_type_size_max);
4349 }
4350
4351 if(option_type_size_min > option_type_size_max) {
4352 type_size_max_ = option_type_size_min;
4353 type_size_min_ = option_type_size_max;
4354 } else {
4355 type_size_min_ = option_type_size_min;
4356 type_size_max_ = option_type_size_max;
4357 }
4358 if(type_size_max_ == 0) {
4359 required_ = false;
4360 }
4361 return this;
4362 }
4363
4365 Option *default_function(const std::function<std::string()> &func) {
4366 default_function_ = func;
4367 return this;
4368 }
4369
4371 Option *capture_default_str() {
4372 if(default_function_) {
4373 default_str_ = default_function_();
4374 }
4375 return this;
4376 }
4377
4379 Option *default_str(std::string val) {
4380 default_str_ = std::move(val);
4381 return this;
4382 }
4383
4386 template <typename X> Option *default_val(const X &val) {
4387 std::string val_str = detail::to_string(val);
4388 auto old_option_state = current_option_state_;
4389 results_t old_results{std::move(results_)};
4390 results_.clear();
4391 try {
4392 add_result(val_str);
4393 if(run_callback_for_default_) {
4394 run_callback(); // run callback sets the state we need to reset it again
4395 current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
4396 } else {
4397 _validate_results(results_);
4398 current_option_state_ = old_option_state;
4399 }
4400 } catch(const CLI::Error &) {
4401 // this should be done
4402 results_ = std::move(old_results);
4403 current_option_state_ = old_option_state;
4404 throw;
4405 }
4406 results_ = std::move(old_results);
4407 default_str_ = std::move(val_str);
4408 return this;
4409 }
4410
4412 std::string get_type_name() const {
4413 std::string full_type_name = type_name_();
4414 if(!validators_.empty()) {
4415 for(auto &Validator : validators_) {
4416 std::string vtype = Validator.get_description();
4417 if(!vtype.empty()) {
4418 full_type_name += ":" + vtype;
4419 }
4420 }
4421 }
4422 return full_type_name;
4423 }
4424
4425 private:
4427 void _validate_results(results_t &res) const {
4428 // Run the Validators (can change the string)
4429 if(!validators_.empty()) {
4430 if(type_size_max_ > 1) { // in this context index refers to the index in the type
4431 int index = 0;
4432 if(get_items_expected_max() < static_cast<int>(res.size()) &&
4433 multi_option_policy_ == CLI::MultiOptionPolicy::TakeLast) {
4434 // create a negative index for the earliest ones
4435 index = get_items_expected_max() - static_cast<int>(res.size());
4436 }
4437
4438 for(std::string &result : res) {
4439 if(result.empty() && type_size_max_ != type_size_min_ && index >= 0) {
4440 index = 0; // reset index for variable size chunks
4441 continue;
4442 }
4443 auto err_msg = _validate(result, (index >= 0) ? (index % type_size_max_) : index);
4444 if(!err_msg.empty())
4445 throw ValidationError(get_name(), err_msg);
4446 ++index;
4447 }
4448 } else {
4449 int index = 0;
4450 if(expected_max_ < static_cast<int>(res.size()) &&
4451 multi_option_policy_ == CLI::MultiOptionPolicy::TakeLast) {
4452 // create a negative index for the earliest ones
4453 index = expected_max_ - static_cast<int>(res.size());
4454 }
4455 for(std::string &result : res) {
4456 auto err_msg = _validate(result, index);
4457 ++index;
4458 if(!err_msg.empty())
4459 throw ValidationError(get_name(), err_msg);
4460 }
4461 }
4462 }
4463 }
4464
4468 void _reduce_results(results_t &res, const results_t &original) const {
4469
4470 // max num items expected or length of vector, always at least 1
4471 // Only valid for a trimming policy
4472
4473 res.clear();
4474 // Operation depends on the policy setting
4475 switch(multi_option_policy_) {
4476 case MultiOptionPolicy::TakeAll:
4477 break;
4478 case MultiOptionPolicy::TakeLast: {
4479 // Allow multi-option sizes (including 0)
4480 std::size_t trim_size = std::min<std::size_t>(
4481 static_cast<std::size_t>(std::max<int>(get_items_expected_max(), 1)), original.size());
4482 if(original.size() != trim_size) {
4483 res.assign(original.end() - static_cast<results_t::difference_type>(trim_size), original.end());
4484 }
4485 } break;
4486 case MultiOptionPolicy::TakeFirst: {
4487 std::size_t trim_size = std::min<std::size_t>(
4488 static_cast<std::size_t>(std::max<int>(get_items_expected_max(), 1)), original.size());
4489 if(original.size() != trim_size) {
4490 res.assign(original.begin(), original.begin() + static_cast<results_t::difference_type>(trim_size));
4491 }
4492 } break;
4493 case MultiOptionPolicy::Join:
4494 if(results_.size() > 1) {
4495 res.push_back(detail::join(original, std::string(1, (delimiter_ == '\0') ? '\n' : delimiter_)));
4496 }
4497 break;
4498 case MultiOptionPolicy::Throw:
4499 default: {
4500 auto num_min = static_cast<std::size_t>(get_items_expected_min());
4501 auto num_max = static_cast<std::size_t>(get_items_expected_max());
4502 if(num_min == 0) {
4503 num_min = 1;
4504 }
4505 if(num_max == 0) {
4506 num_max = 1;
4507 }
4508 if(original.size() < num_min) {
4509 throw ArgumentMismatch::AtLeast(get_name(), static_cast<int>(num_min), original.size());
4510 }
4511 if(original.size() > num_max) {
4512 throw ArgumentMismatch::AtMost(get_name(), static_cast<int>(num_max), original.size());
4513 }
4514 break;
4515 }
4516 }
4517 }
4518
4519 // Run a result through the Validators
4520 std::string _validate(std::string &result, int index) const {
4521 std::string err_msg;
4522 if(result.empty() && expected_min_ == 0) {
4523 // an empty with nothing expected is allowed
4524 return err_msg;
4525 }
4526 for(const auto &vali : validators_) {
4527 auto v = vali.get_application_index();
4528 if(v == -1 || v == index) {
4529 try {
4530 err_msg = vali(result);
4531 } catch(const ValidationError &err) {
4532 err_msg = err.what();
4533 }
4534 if(!err_msg.empty())
4535 break;
4536 }
4537 }
4538
4539 return err_msg;
4540 }
4541
4543 int _add_result(std::string &&result, std::vector<std::string> &res) const {
4544 int result_count = 0;
4545 if(allow_extra_args_ && !result.empty() && result.front() == '[' &&
4546 result.back() == ']') { // this is now a vector string likely from the default or user entry
4547 result.pop_back();
4548
4549 for(auto &var : CLI::detail::split(result.substr(1), ',')) {
4550 if(!var.empty()) {
4551 result_count += _add_result(std::move(var), res);
4552 }
4553 }
4554 return result_count;
4555 }
4556 if(delimiter_ == '\0') {
4557 res.push_back(std::move(result));
4558 ++result_count;
4559 } else {
4560 if((result.find_first_of(delimiter_) != std::string::npos)) {
4561 for(const auto &var : CLI::detail::split(result, delimiter_)) {
4562 if(!var.empty()) {
4563 res.push_back(var);
4564 ++result_count;
4565 }
4566 }
4567 } else {
4568 res.push_back(std::move(result));
4569 ++result_count;
4570 }
4571 }
4572 return result_count;
4573 }
4574}; // namespace CLI
4575
4576} // namespace CLI
4577
4578// From CLI/App.hpp:
4579
4580namespace CLI {
4581
4582#ifndef CLI11_PARSE
4583#define CLI11_PARSE(app, argc, argv) \
4584 try { \
4585 (app).parse((argc), (argv)); \
4586 } catch(const CLI::ParseError &e) { \
4587 return (app).exit(e); \
4588 }
4589#endif
4590
4591namespace detail {
4592enum class Classifier { NONE, POSITIONAL_MARK, SHORT, LONG, WINDOWS, SUBCOMMAND, SUBCOMMAND_TERMINATOR };
4593struct AppFriend;
4594} // namespace detail
4595
4596namespace FailureMessage {
4597std::string simple(const App *app, const Error &e);
4598std::string help(const App *app, const Error &e);
4599} // namespace FailureMessage
4600
4602
4603enum class config_extras_mode : char { error = 0, ignore, capture };
4604
4605class App;
4606
4607using App_p = std::shared_ptr<App>;
4608
4609class Option_group;
4611
4614class App {
4615 friend Option;
4616 friend detail::AppFriend;
4617
4618 protected:
4619 // This library follows the Google style guide for member names ending in underscores

4635 config_extras_mode allow_config_extras_{config_extras_mode::ignore};

4645

4705 missing_t missing_{};

4711 std::vector<App *> parsed_subcommands_{};

4714 std::set<App *> exclude_subcommands_{};

4758 startup_mode default_startup{startup_mode::stable};

4801
4803 App(std::string app_description, std::string app_name, App *parent)
4804 : name_(std::move(app_name)), description_(std::move(app_description)), parent_(parent) {
4805 // Inherit if not from a nullptr
4806 if(parent_ != nullptr) {
4807 if(parent_->help_ptr_ != nullptr)
4808 set_help_flag(parent_->help_ptr_->get_name(false, true), parent_->help_ptr_->get_description());
4809 if(parent_->help_all_ptr_ != nullptr)
4810 set_help_all_flag(parent_->help_all_ptr_->get_name(false, true),
4811 parent_->help_all_ptr_->get_description());
4812
4814 option_defaults_ = parent_->option_defaults_;
4815
4816 // INHERITABLE
4817 failure_message_ = parent_->failure_message_;
4818 allow_extras_ = parent_->allow_extras_;
4819 allow_config_extras_ = parent_->allow_config_extras_;
4820 prefix_command_ = parent_->prefix_command_;
4821 immediate_callback_ = parent_->immediate_callback_;
4822 ignore_case_ = parent_->ignore_case_;
4823 ignore_underscore_ = parent_->ignore_underscore_;
4824 fallthrough_ = parent_->fallthrough_;
4825 validate_positionals_ = parent_->validate_positionals_;
4826 configurable_ = parent_->configurable_;
4827 allow_windows_style_options_ = parent_->allow_windows_style_options_;
4828 group_ = parent_->group_;
4829 footer_ = parent_->footer_;
4830 formatter_ = parent_->formatter_;
4831 config_formatter_ = parent_->config_formatter_;
4832 require_subcommand_max_ = parent_->require_subcommand_max_;
4833 }
4834 }
4835
4836 public:
4839
4841 explicit App(std::string app_description = "", std::string app_name = "")
4842 : App(app_description, app_name, nullptr) {
4843 set_help_flag("-h,--help", "Print this help message and exit");
4844 }
4845
4846 App(const App &) = delete;
4847 App &operator=(const App &) = delete;
4848
4850 virtual ~App() = default;
4851
4858 App *callback(std::function<void()> app_callback) {
4859 if(immediate_callback_) {
4860 parse_complete_callback_ = std::move(app_callback);
4861 } else {
4862 final_callback_ = std::move(app_callback);
4863 }
4864 return this;
4865 }
4866
4869 App *final_callback(std::function<void()> app_callback) {
4870 final_callback_ = std::move(app_callback);
4871 return this;
4872 }
4873
4876 App *parse_complete_callback(std::function<void()> pc_callback) {
4877 parse_complete_callback_ = std::move(pc_callback);
4878 return this;
4879 }
4880
4883 App *preparse_callback(std::function<void(std::size_t)> pp_callback) {
4884 pre_parse_callback_ = std::move(pp_callback);
4885 return this;
4886 }
4887
4889 App *name(std::string app_name = "") {
4890
4891 if(parent_ != nullptr) {
4892 auto oname = name_;
4893 name_ = app_name;
4894 auto &res = _compare_subcommand_names(*this, *_get_fallthrough_parent());
4895 if(!res.empty()) {
4896 name_ = oname;
4897 throw(OptionAlreadyAdded(app_name + " conflicts with existing subcommand names"));
4898 }
4899 } else {
4900 name_ = app_name;
4901 }
4902 has_automatic_name_ = false;
4903 return this;
4904 }
4905
4907 App *alias(std::string app_name) {
4908 if(!detail::valid_name_string(app_name)) {
4909 throw(IncorrectConstruction("alias is not a valid name string"));
4910 }
4911
4912 if(parent_ != nullptr) {
4913 aliases_.push_back(app_name);
4914 auto &res = _compare_subcommand_names(*this, *_get_fallthrough_parent());
4915 if(!res.empty()) {
4916 aliases_.pop_back();
4917 throw(OptionAlreadyAdded("alias already matches an existing subcommand: " + app_name));
4918 }
4919 } else {
4920 aliases_.push_back(app_name);
4921 }
4922
4923 return this;
4924 }
4925
4927 App *allow_extras(bool allow = true) {
4928 allow_extras_ = allow;
4929 return this;
4930 }
4931
4933 App *required(bool require = true) {
4934 required_ = require;
4935 return this;
4936 }
4937
4939 App *disabled(bool disable = true) {
4940 disabled_ = disable;
4941 return this;
4942 }
4943
4945 App *disabled_by_default(bool disable = true) {
4946 if(disable) {
4947 default_startup = startup_mode::disabled;
4948 } else {
4949 default_startup = (default_startup == startup_mode::enabled) ? startup_mode::enabled : startup_mode::stable;
4950 }
4951 return this;
4952 }
4953
4956 App *enabled_by_default(bool enable = true) {
4957 if(enable) {
4958 default_startup = startup_mode::enabled;
4959 } else {
4960 default_startup =
4961 (default_startup == startup_mode::disabled) ? startup_mode::disabled : startup_mode::stable;
4962 }
4963 return this;
4964 }
4965
4967 App *immediate_callback(bool immediate = true) {
4968 immediate_callback_ = immediate;
4969 if(immediate_callback_) {
4970 if(final_callback_ && !(parse_complete_callback_)) {
4971 std::swap(final_callback_, parse_complete_callback_);
4972 }
4973 } else if(!(final_callback_) && parse_complete_callback_) {
4974 std::swap(final_callback_, parse_complete_callback_);
4975 }
4976 return this;
4977 }
4978
4980 App *validate_positionals(bool validate = true) {
4981 validate_positionals_ = validate;
4982 return this;
4983 }
4984
4986 App *allow_config_extras(bool allow = true) {
4987 if(allow) {
4988 allow_config_extras_ = config_extras_mode::capture;
4989 allow_extras_ = true;
4990 } else {
4991 allow_config_extras_ = config_extras_mode::error;
4992 }
4993 return this;
4994 }
4995
4997 App *allow_config_extras(config_extras_mode mode) {
4998 allow_config_extras_ = mode;
4999 return this;
5000 }
5001
5003 App *prefix_command(bool allow = true) {
5004 prefix_command_ = allow;
5005 return this;
5006 }
5007
5009 App *ignore_case(bool value = true) {
5010 if(value && !ignore_case_) {
5011 ignore_case_ = true;
5012 auto *p = (parent_ != nullptr) ? _get_fallthrough_parent() : this;
5013 auto &match = _compare_subcommand_names(*this, *p);
5014 if(!match.empty()) {
5015 ignore_case_ = false; // we are throwing so need to be exception invariant
5016 throw OptionAlreadyAdded("ignore case would cause subcommand name conflicts: " + match);
5017 }
5018 }
5019 ignore_case_ = value;
5020 return this;
5021 }
5022
5025 App *allow_windows_style_options(bool value = true) {
5026 allow_windows_style_options_ = value;
5027 return this;
5028 }
5029
5031 App *positionals_at_end(bool value = true) {
5032 positionals_at_end_ = value;
5033 return this;
5034 }
5035
5037 App *configurable(bool value = true) {
5038 configurable_ = value;
5039 return this;
5040 }
5041
5043 App *ignore_underscore(bool value = true) {
5044 if(value && !ignore_underscore_) {
5045 ignore_underscore_ = true;
5046 auto *p = (parent_ != nullptr) ? _get_fallthrough_parent() : this;
5047 auto &match = _compare_subcommand_names(*this, *p);
5048 if(!match.empty()) {
5049 ignore_underscore_ = false;
5050 throw OptionAlreadyAdded("ignore underscore would cause subcommand name conflicts: " + match);
5051 }
5052 }
5053 ignore_underscore_ = value;
5054 return this;
5055 }
5056
5058 App *formatter(std::shared_ptr<FormatterBase> fmt) {
5059 formatter_ = fmt;
5060 return this;
5061 }
5062
5064 App *formatter_fn(std::function<std::string(const App *, std::string, AppFormatMode)> fmt) {
5065 formatter_ = std::make_shared<FormatterLambda>(fmt);
5066 return this;
5067 }
5068
5070 App *config_formatter(std::shared_ptr<Config> fmt) {
5071 config_formatter_ = fmt;
5072 return this;
5073 }
5074
5076 bool parsed() const { return parsed_ > 0; }
5077
5079 OptionDefaults *option_defaults() { return &option_defaults_; }
5080
5084
5099 Option *add_option(std::string option_name,
5100 callback_t option_callback,
5101 std::string option_description = "",
5102 bool defaulted = false,
5103 std::function<std::string()> func = {}) {
5104 Option myopt{option_name, option_description, option_callback, this};
5105
5106 if(std::find_if(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_), [&myopt](const Option_p &v) {
5107 return *v == myopt;
5108 }) == std::end(options_)) {
5109 options_.emplace_back();
5110 Option_p &option = options_.back();
5111 option.reset(new Option(option_name, option_description, option_callback, this));
5112
5113 // Set the default string capture function
5114 option->default_function(func);
5115
5116 // For compatibility with CLI11 1.7 and before, capture the default string here
5117 if(defaulted)
5118 option->capture_default_str();
5119
5120 // Transfer defaults to the new option
5121 option_defaults_.copy_to(option.get());
5122
5123 // Don't bother to capture if we already did
5124 if(!defaulted && option->get_always_capture_default())
5125 option->capture_default_str();
5126
5127 return option.get();
5128 }
5129 // we know something matches now find what it is so we can produce more error information
5130 for(auto &opt : options_) {
5131 auto &matchname = opt->matching_name(myopt);
5132 if(!matchname.empty()) {
5133 throw(OptionAlreadyAdded("added option matched existing option name: " + matchname));
5134 }
5135 }
5136 // this line should not be reached the above loop should trigger the throw
5137 throw(OptionAlreadyAdded("added option matched existing option name")); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
5138 }
5139
5141 template <typename AssignTo,
5142 typename ConvertTo = AssignTo,
5143 enable_if_t<!std::is_const<ConvertTo>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
5144 Option *add_option(std::string option_name,
5145 AssignTo &variable,
5146 std::string option_description = "",
5147 bool defaulted = false) {
5148
5149 auto fun = [&variable](const CLI::results_t &res) { // comment for spacing
5150 return detail::lexical_conversion<AssignTo, ConvertTo>(res, variable);
5151 };
5152
5153 Option *opt = add_option(option_name, fun, option_description, defaulted, [&variable]() {
5154 return CLI::detail::checked_to_string<AssignTo, ConvertTo>(variable);
5155 });
5156 opt->type_name(detail::type_name<ConvertTo>());
5157 // these must be actual lvalues since (std::max) sometimes is defined in terms of references and references
5158 // to structs used in the evaluation can be temporary so that would cause issues.
5159 auto Tcount = detail::type_count<AssignTo>::value;
5160 auto XCcount = detail::type_count<ConvertTo>::value;
5161 opt->type_size((std::max)(Tcount, XCcount));
5162 opt->expected(detail::expected_count<ConvertTo>::value);
5163 opt->run_callback_for_default();
5164 return opt;
5165 }
5166
5168 template <typename T>
5169 Option *add_option_function(std::string option_name,
5170 const std::function<void(const T &)> &func,
5171 std::string option_description = "") {
5172
5173 auto fun = [func](const CLI::results_t &res) {
5174 T variable;
5175 bool result = detail::lexical_conversion<T, T>(res, variable);
5176 if(result) {
5177 func(variable);
5178 }
5179 return result;
5180 };
5181
5182 Option *opt = add_option(option_name, std::move(fun), option_description, false);
5183 opt->type_name(detail::type_name<T>());
5184 opt->type_size(detail::type_count<T>::value);
5185 opt->expected(detail::expected_count<T>::value);
5186 return opt;
5187 }
5188
5190 Option *add_option(std::string option_name) {
5191 return add_option(option_name, CLI::callback_t(), std::string{}, false);
5192 }
5193
5195 template <typename T,
5196 enable_if_t<std::is_const<T>::value && std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value, detail::enabler> =
5197 detail::dummy>
5198 Option *add_option(std::string option_name, T &option_description) {
5199 return add_option(option_name, CLI::callback_t(), option_description, false);
5200 }
5201
5203 Option *set_help_flag(std::string flag_name = "", const std::string &help_description = "") {
5204 // take flag_description by const reference otherwise add_flag tries to assign to help_description
5205 if(help_ptr_ != nullptr) {
5206 remove_option(help_ptr_);
5207 help_ptr_ = nullptr;
5208 }
5209
5210 // Empty name will simply remove the help flag
5211 if(!flag_name.empty()) {
5212 help_ptr_ = add_flag(flag_name, help_description);
5213 help_ptr_->configurable(false);
5214 }
5215
5216 return help_ptr_;
5217 }
5218
5220 Option *set_help_all_flag(std::string help_name = "", const std::string &help_description = "") {
5221 // take flag_description by const reference otherwise add_flag tries to assign to flag_description
5222 if(help_all_ptr_ != nullptr) {
5223 remove_option(help_all_ptr_);
5224 help_all_ptr_ = nullptr;
5225 }
5226
5227 // Empty name will simply remove the help all flag
5228 if(!help_name.empty()) {
5229 help_all_ptr_ = add_flag(help_name, help_description);
5230 help_all_ptr_->configurable(false);
5231 }
5232
5233 return help_all_ptr_;
5234 }
5235
5236 private:
5238 Option *_add_flag_internal(std::string flag_name, CLI::callback_t fun, std::string flag_description) {
5239 Option *opt;
5240 if(detail::has_default_flag_values(flag_name)) {
5241 // check for default values and if it has them
5242 auto flag_defaults = detail::get_default_flag_values(flag_name);
5243 detail::remove_default_flag_values(flag_name);
5244 opt = add_option(std::move(flag_name), std::move(fun), std::move(flag_description), false);
5245 for(const auto &fname : flag_defaults)
5246 opt->fnames_.push_back(fname.first);
5247 opt->default_flag_values_ = std::move(flag_defaults);
5248 } else {
5249 opt = add_option(std::move(flag_name), std::move(fun), std::move(flag_description), false);
5250 }
5251 // flags cannot have positional values
5252 if(opt->get_positional()) {
5253 auto pos_name = opt->get_name(true);
5254 remove_option(opt);
5255 throw IncorrectConstruction::PositionalFlag(pos_name);
5256 }
5257 opt->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeLast);
5258 opt->expected(0);
5259 opt->required(false);
5260 return opt;
5261 }
5262
5263 public:
5265 Option *add_flag(std::string flag_name) { return _add_flag_internal(flag_name, CLI::callback_t(), std::string{}); }
5266
5270 template <typename T,
5271 enable_if_t<std::is_const<T>::value && std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value, detail::enabler> =
5272 detail::dummy>
5273 Option *add_flag(std::string flag_name, T &flag_description) {
5274 return _add_flag_internal(flag_name, CLI::callback_t(), flag_description);
5275 }
5276
5279 template <typename T,
5280 enable_if_t<std::is_integral<T>::value && !is_bool<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
5281 Option *add_flag(std::string flag_name,
5282 T &flag_count,
5283 std::string flag_description = "") {
5284 flag_count = 0;
5285 CLI::callback_t fun = [&flag_count](const CLI::results_t &res) {
5286 try {
5287 detail::sum_flag_vector(res, flag_count);
5288 } catch(const std::invalid_argument &) {
5289 return false;
5290 }
5291 return true;
5292 };
5293 return _add_flag_internal(flag_name, std::move(fun), std::move(flag_description))
5294 ->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeAll);
5295 }
5296
5299 template <typename T,
5300 enable_if_t<!is_vector<T>::value && !std::is_const<T>::value &&
5301 (!std::is_integral<T>::value || is_bool<T>::value) &&
5302 !std::is_constructible<std::function<void(int)>, T>::value,
5303 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
5304 Option *add_flag(std::string flag_name,
5305 T &flag_result,
5306 std::string flag_description = "") {
5307
5308 CLI::callback_t fun = [&flag_result](const CLI::results_t &res) {
5309 return CLI::detail::lexical_cast(res[0], flag_result);
5310 };
5311 return _add_flag_internal(flag_name, std::move(fun), std::move(flag_description))->run_callback_for_default();
5312 }
5313
5315 template <typename T,
5316 enable_if_t<!std::is_assignable<std::function<void(int64_t)>, T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
5317 Option *add_flag(std::string flag_name,
5318 std::vector<T> &flag_results,
5319 std::string flag_description = "") {
5320 CLI::callback_t fun = [&flag_results](const CLI::results_t &res) {
5321 bool retval = true;
5322 for(const auto &elem : res) {
5323 flag_results.emplace_back();
5324 retval &= detail::lexical_cast(elem, flag_results.back());
5325 }
5326 return retval;
5327 };
5328 return _add_flag_internal(flag_name, std::move(fun), std::move(flag_description))
5329 ->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeAll)
5330 ->run_callback_for_default();
5331 }
5332
5334 Option *add_flag_callback(std::string flag_name,
5335 std::function<void(void)> function,
5336 std::string flag_description = "") {
5337
5338 CLI::callback_t fun = [function](const CLI::results_t &res) {
5339 bool trigger{false};
5340 auto result = CLI::detail::lexical_cast(res[0], trigger);
5341 if(result && trigger) {
5342 function();
5343 }
5344 return result;
5345 };
5346 return _add_flag_internal(flag_name, std::move(fun), std::move(flag_description));
5347 }
5348
5350 Option *add_flag_function(std::string flag_name,
5351 std::function<void(int64_t)> function,
5352 std::string flag_description = "") {
5353
5354 CLI::callback_t fun = [function](const CLI::results_t &res) {
5355 int64_t flag_count = 0;
5356 detail::sum_flag_vector(res, flag_count);
5357 function(flag_count);
5358 return true;
5359 };
5360 return _add_flag_internal(flag_name, std::move(fun), std::move(flag_description))
5361 ->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeAll);
5362 }
5363
5364#ifdef CLI11_CPP14
5366 Option *add_flag(std::string flag_name,
5367 std::function<void(int64_t)> function,
5368 std::string flag_description = "") {
5369 return add_flag_function(std::move(flag_name), std::move(function), std::move(flag_description));
5370 }
5371#endif
5372
5374 template <typename T>
5375 Option *add_set(std::string option_name,
5376 T &member,
5377 std::set<T> options,
5378 std::string option_description = "") {
5379
5380 Option *opt = add_option(option_name, member, std::move(option_description));
5381 opt->check(IsMember{options});
5382 return opt;
5383 }
5384
5386 template <typename T>
5387 Option *add_mutable_set(std::string option_name,
5388 T &member,
5389 const std::set<T> &options,
5390 std::string option_description = "") {
5391
5392 Option *opt = add_option(option_name, member, std::move(option_description));
5393 opt->check(IsMember{&options});
5394 return opt;
5395 }
5396
5398 template <typename T>
5399 Option *add_set(std::string option_name,
5400 T &member,
5401 std::set<T> options,
5402 std::string option_description,
5403 bool defaulted) {
5404
5405 Option *opt = add_option(option_name, member, std::move(option_description), defaulted);
5406 opt->check(IsMember{options});
5407 return opt;
5408 }
5409
5411 template <typename T>
5412 Option *add_mutable_set(std::string option_name,
5413 T &member,
5414 const std::set<T> &options,
5415 std::string option_description,
5416 bool defaulted) {
5417
5418 Option *opt = add_option(option_name, member, std::move(option_description), defaulted);
5419 opt->check(IsMember{&options});
5420 return opt;
5421 }
5422
5424 template <typename T, typename XC = double>
5425 Option *add_complex(std::string option_name,
5426 T &variable,
5427 std::string option_description = "",
5428 bool defaulted = false,
5429 std::string label = "COMPLEX") {
5430
5431 CLI::callback_t fun = [&variable](const results_t &res) {
5432 XC x, y;
5433 bool worked;
5434 if(res.size() >= 2 && !res[1].empty()) {
5435 auto str1 = res[1];
5436 if(str1.back() == 'i' || str1.back() == 'j')
5437 str1.pop_back();
5438 worked = detail::lexical_cast(res[0], x) && detail::lexical_cast(str1, y);
5439 } else {
5440 auto str1 = res.front();
5441 auto nloc = str1.find_last_of('-');
5442 if(nloc != std::string::npos && nloc > 0) {
5443 worked = detail::lexical_cast(str1.substr(0, nloc), x);
5444 str1 = str1.substr(nloc);
5445 if(str1.back() == 'i' || str1.back() == 'j')
5446 str1.pop_back();
5447 worked = worked && detail::lexical_cast(str1, y);
5448 } else {
5449 if(str1.back() == 'i' || str1.back() == 'j') {
5450 str1.pop_back();
5451 worked = detail::lexical_cast(str1, y);
5452 x = XC{0};
5453 } else {
5454 worked = detail::lexical_cast(str1, x);
5455 y = XC{0};
5456 }
5457 }
5458 }
5459 if(worked)
5460 variable = T{x, y};
5461 return worked;
5462 };
5463
5464 auto default_function = [&variable]() { return CLI::detail::checked_to_string<T, T>(variable); };
5465
5466 CLI::Option *opt =
5467 add_option(option_name, std::move(fun), std::move(option_description), defaulted, default_function);
5468
5469 opt->type_name(label)->type_size(1, 2)->delimiter('+')->run_callback_for_default();
5470 return opt;
5471 }
5472
5474 Option *set_config(std::string option_name = "",
5475 std::string default_filename = "",
5476 const std::string &help_message = "Read an ini file",
5477 bool config_required = false) {
5478
5479 // Remove existing config if present
5480 if(config_ptr_ != nullptr) {
5481 remove_option(config_ptr_);
5482 config_ptr_ = nullptr; // need to remove the config_ptr completely
5483 }
5484
5485 // Only add config if option passed
5486 if(!option_name.empty()) {
5487 config_ptr_ = add_option(option_name, help_message);
5488 if(config_required) {
5489 config_ptr_->required();
5490 }
5491 if(!default_filename.empty()) {
5492 config_ptr_->default_str(std::move(default_filename));
5493 }
5494 config_ptr_->configurable(false);
5495 }
5496
5497 return config_ptr_;
5498 }
5499
5501 bool remove_option(Option *opt) {
5502 // Make sure no links exist
5503 for(Option_p &op : options_) {
5504 op->remove_needs(opt);
5505 op->remove_excludes(opt);
5506 }
5507
5508 if(help_ptr_ == opt)
5509 help_ptr_ = nullptr;
5510 if(help_all_ptr_ == opt)
5511 help_all_ptr_ = nullptr;
5512
5513 auto iterator =
5514 std::find_if(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_), [opt](const Option_p &v) { return v.get() == opt; });
5515 if(iterator != std::end(options_)) {
5516 options_.erase(iterator);
5517 return true;
5518 }
5519 return false;
5520 }
5521
5523 template <typename T = Option_group>
5524 T *add_option_group(std::string group_name, std::string group_description = "") {
5525 auto option_group = std::make_shared<T>(std::move(group_description), group_name, nullptr);
5526 auto ptr = option_group.get();
5527 // move to App_p for overload resolution on older gcc versions
5528 App_p app_ptr = std::dynamic_pointer_cast<App>(option_group);
5529 add_subcommand(std::move(app_ptr));
5530 return ptr;
5531 }
5532
5536
5538 App *add_subcommand(std::string subcommand_name = "", std::string subcommand_description = "") {
5539 if(!subcommand_name.empty() && !detail::valid_name_string(subcommand_name)) {
5540 throw IncorrectConstruction("subcommand name is not valid");
5541 }
5542 CLI::App_p subcom = std::shared_ptr<App>(new App(std::move(subcommand_description), subcommand_name, this));
5543 return add_subcommand(std::move(subcom));
5544 }
5545
5547 App *add_subcommand(CLI::App_p subcom) {
5548 if(!subcom)
5549 throw IncorrectConstruction("passed App is not valid");
5550 auto ckapp = (name_.empty() && parent_ != nullptr) ? _get_fallthrough_parent() : this;
5551 auto &mstrg = _compare_subcommand_names(*subcom, *ckapp);
5552 if(!mstrg.empty()) {
5553 throw(OptionAlreadyAdded("subcommand name or alias matches existing subcommand: " + mstrg));
5554 }
5555 subcom->parent_ = this;
5556 subcommands_.push_back(std::move(subcom));
5557 return subcommands_.back().get();
5558 }
5559
5561 bool remove_subcommand(App *subcom) {
5562 // Make sure no links exist
5563 for(App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
5564 sub->remove_excludes(subcom);
5565 sub->remove_needs(subcom);
5566 }
5567
5568 auto iterator = std::find_if(
5569 std::begin(subcommands_), std::end(subcommands_), [subcom](const App_p &v) { return v.get() == subcom; });
5570 if(iterator != std::end(subcommands_)) {
5571 subcommands_.erase(iterator);
5572 return true;
5573 }
5574 return false;
5575 }
5578 App *get_subcommand(const App *subcom) const {
5579 if(subcom == nullptr)
5580 throw OptionNotFound("nullptr passed");
5581 for(const App_p &subcomptr : subcommands_)
5582 if(subcomptr.get() == subcom)
5583 return subcomptr.get();
5584 throw OptionNotFound(subcom->get_name());
5585 }
5586
5588 App *get_subcommand(std::string subcom) const {
5589 auto subc = _find_subcommand(subcom, false, false);
5590 if(subc == nullptr)
5591 throw OptionNotFound(subcom);
5592 return subc;
5593 }
5595 App *get_subcommand(int index = 0) const {
5596 if(index >= 0) {
5597 auto uindex = static_cast<unsigned>(index);
5598 if(uindex < subcommands_.size())
5599 return subcommands_[uindex].get();
5600 }
5601 throw OptionNotFound(std::to_string(index));
5602 }
5603
5605 CLI::App_p get_subcommand_ptr(App *subcom) const {
5606 if(subcom == nullptr)
5607 throw OptionNotFound("nullptr passed");
5608 for(const App_p &subcomptr : subcommands_)
5609 if(subcomptr.get() == subcom)
5610 return subcomptr;
5611 throw OptionNotFound(subcom->get_name());
5612 }
5613
5615 CLI::App_p get_subcommand_ptr(std::string subcom) const {
5616 for(const App_p &subcomptr : subcommands_)
5617 if(subcomptr->check_name(subcom))
5618 return subcomptr;
5619 throw OptionNotFound(subcom);
5620 }
5621
5623 CLI::App_p get_subcommand_ptr(int index = 0) const {
5624 if(index >= 0) {
5625 auto uindex = static_cast<unsigned>(index);
5626 if(uindex < subcommands_.size())
5627 return subcommands_[uindex];
5628 }
5629 throw OptionNotFound(std::to_string(index));
5630 }
5631
5633 App *get_option_group(std::string group_name) const {
5634 for(const App_p &app : subcommands_) {
5635 if(app->name_.empty() && app->group_ == group_name) {
5636 return app.get();
5637 }
5638 }
5639 throw OptionNotFound(group_name);
5640 }
5641
5645 std::size_t count() const { return parsed_; }
5646
5649 std::size_t count_all() const {
5650 std::size_t cnt{0};
5651 for(auto &opt : options_) {
5652 cnt += opt->count();
5653 }
5654 for(auto &sub : subcommands_) {
5655 cnt += sub->count_all();
5656 }
5657 if(!get_name().empty()) { // for named subcommands add the number of times the subcommand was called
5658 cnt += parsed_;
5659 }
5660 return cnt;
5661 }
5662
5664 App *group(std::string group_name) {
5665 group_ = group_name;
5666 return this;
5667 }
5668
5670 App *require_subcommand() {
5671 require_subcommand_min_ = 1;
5672 require_subcommand_max_ = 0;
5673 return this;
5674 }
5675
5679 App *require_subcommand(int value) {
5680 if(value < 0) {
5681 require_subcommand_min_ = 0;
5682 require_subcommand_max_ = static_cast<std::size_t>(-value);
5683 } else {
5684 require_subcommand_min_ = static_cast<std::size_t>(value);
5685 require_subcommand_max_ = static_cast<std::size_t>(value);
5686 }
5687 return this;
5688 }
5689
5692 App *require_subcommand(std::size_t min, std::size_t max) {
5693 require_subcommand_min_ = min;
5694 require_subcommand_max_ = max;
5695 return this;
5696 }
5697
5699 App *require_option() {
5700 require_option_min_ = 1;
5701 require_option_max_ = 0;
5702 return this;
5703 }
5704
5708 App *require_option(int value) {
5709 if(value < 0) {
5710 require_option_min_ = 0;
5711 require_option_max_ = static_cast<std::size_t>(-value);
5712 } else {
5713 require_option_min_ = static_cast<std::size_t>(value);
5714 require_option_max_ = static_cast<std::size_t>(value);
5715 }
5716 return this;
5717 }
5718
5721 App *require_option(std::size_t min, std::size_t max) {
5722 require_option_min_ = min;
